The best husband/sons ever! My name is Sonya and about a year ago I stepped on a nail and fell down a flight of stairs and in a blink of an eye went from a normal woman married and in love to the same man for 26 yrs. with 2 sons 25 and 23 who are the biggest Falcons fans ever! Sadly because of all my procedures, they had to put cement into nine verta. so that I could live a somewhat normal life. My husband and I were both back in college getting our degrees when I had to quit because just the pain alone was to much to bare. Now I am slowly able to get out of the house, well actually we lost our home a few days ago because my husband had to take so much time off of work to care for me that now we are just living on hope and love. We lost everything and now my oldest son Jonathan has also put is life on hold so we could stay with him in is tiny apart. in Tampa. However in less than a year my husband will graduate and has decided that he will go ahead and go for is MA. and I am going to go back to college within a few months and finish getting my BA. I am telling you this story because when I seen how the NFL loves Levis just as we do I just knew that even though we have no more than 2 outfits each and if I could do anything to thank my husband and sons, I would take them to a Falcons game and make sure they were decked with some great levis but until that day comes. I just wanted to put this out there in cyberspace letting the world know I am humbled and proud of just how much they have given up just for me. I can't wait for the day that I will be able to pay it forward. Much love and Bless you all!

To whom it may concern, 
I sent multiple emails and no one responded, so I figured I would try here.....I am life long customer of Levi's and their 501 jeans. Over the last few years I have noticed a drop in the quality of these jeans. I have a dozen pairs that have torn in the crotch before I even see any wear on the knee. I haven't had a pair last a year. They use less material on the hem of the pant legs and they roll up and stayed rolled up whether you want them to or not. I always liked the quality of these jeans, obviously something that has been compromised to save money. However, @50 a pair these aren't cheap and the consumers costs keep going up. I do not understand. I expect them to last longer. Until such time as these issues are worked out I will no longer buy Levi's brand jeans. Sincerely.

THIS happened to my daughter-in- law in Oregon. Wrong. Very wrong...

I know what size and shape I am. At least I thought I did till I went into the Levi store in Lincoln City. Tom and I entered the store and were greeted with a "can I help you?"  As Tom wandered off I said to the lady "yes, I bought this pair of jeans and I like them but forget what they are called, do you have them?" 
Without asking me any questions she answered "well I can tell you we probably don't have what you are looking for. The closest thing we have to a boyfriend cut is the 501. We don't carry anything for curvy girls here. I'm wearing the 501 right now and I don't have ANY curves" she then proceeded to walk around me once, even pulled the top of my jeans out in the back to look for elastic in the waist. All of this in the middle of the store room floor in front of every customer. 
She then said something about buying jeans with stretch and something about another store that honestly I don't remember because at this point I was like I deer in headlights. 
It was then my darling husband turned around from the corner he was in and looked at my face. Walking towards me as the woman asked is there anything else she could help me with. "No, I think I'll just go." I said and started for the door. Tom asked me what was wrong. I told him "they don't have anything for curvy girls" and we left. I spent the next 20 min in a complete daze! Something like this has never happened to me before. I'm still not quite sure what to make of it. That woman never asked me what size I am or anything. It almost ruined my shopping for the day. But I needed jeans really bad as I was down to one pair. So I finally went to old navy and got myself some curvy girl size 12s. Thank GOD there is at least one store who's manufacturers carry enough bolts and bolts of fabric to cover my enormous ASS!
Yeah I think I'm a little over being hurt and have moved straight on to mad!

Dear Dockers,

I am writing to share my less than ideal experience at one of your stores in 1 Utama mall. I purchased a Dockers Premium Edition Alpha Khaki from the store and left it in your capable hands to alter it.

When I returned to pick up my Khaki, I was surprised to see that the store had used a thread of a completely different colour, and the stitching was substandard.

I expressed my displeasure to the girls at the store. One of the girls who attended to my concern was disinterested in listening to what I had to say. Instead, she mentioned that everyone in Malaysia knows that this is the kind of stitching people get when they get trousers altered. I would like to point out here that I have had a better experience getting my pants altered at a local shop. And I expected even better experience from an international brand.

When I asked about the colour of the thread, she mentioned that the store received the trousers today, and they haven’t had the chance to get the thread of the correct colour, and this is the best they can do. I guess she did not think that it was necessary to inform me when I asked her to alter the Khakis. When I insisted, she came back with a couple of options with an expectation that I’ll instruct her which colour to use. I did not think it was my job to suggest the colour of the thread.

I politely asked for an exchange since they were unable to rectify my problem. However, my request was declined by portraying that it was my error that I didn’t know either of the things. Supervisor was less than helpful too. I think they got away because I am not local (I am from New Zealand) and did not raise my voice at them.

The people at the store were unapologetic for what they did to me. I will urge to people to avoid shopping at Dockers 1 Utama.

I hope that you, Dockers, would listen to me as a customer and not avoid me like people at the store. I expect that someone from your company will rectify my problem.

Thanks and Kind Regards,
Vivek

Just wanted to voice this: I recently bought some new Levi's jeans. The curve ID line have been my go to for years. They were the only jeans that wouldn't do that gapping thing in the back plus they were high quality cotton with just a touch of elastic so they really lasted and wore in beautifully. It's been two years since my last denim purchase and I was sad to see they have been discontinued. I did however purchase two pair of the 711 skinnies and one pair of the 501 cts. The 501s are great! 100% cotton, super comfy yet durable and cool feeling. The 711s however are awful. I didn't realize they had such a high amount of polyester in them. They feel like I'm wearing stretch pants and have an immediate hot and itchy feeling that cotton denim does not have. I regret purchasing them and will return them. This is so disappointing because Levi's were like the last good quality affordable jeans for women out there. I know your men's jeans are still the same as always, so why do clothing companies continue to downgrade the quality of only women's apparel?!? Women want good quality comfortable lasting clothes as well. Maybe I am in the minority on that, but I just thought you should hear one long time customer's opinion. I hope you return to making high quality women's clothing across the board again in the future.

Just popping in to say you guys have some of the worst customer service people handling your online orders. I had an order placed that qualified for a 35% coupon code. Upon receiving the order two of the items did not fit so I went to your store to exchange them for a different size. The customer associate in the store told me that they were online only so I left and called customer service.

The 1st person I talked to from Levis told me they were out of stock on the items. I had the website pulled up told the customer service agent that I could add them to my cart and Levis online showed them in stock. The customer service agent told me just reorder them and I would have to call back with my order number to have the price adjusted.

The 2nd person I talked to said since I used a 20% off coupon my 2nd order (to limited the pending charge amount on my card) that she would take an addition 15% after the initial 20%. I told her that "x" amount of dollars minus 15% then minus 20% separately did not total 35%. Anyone with a basic understanding of mathematics would understand that. I asked why she couldn't just match the prices of the items and she just repeated she would take an additional 15% off the initial 20%... I told her I would just cancel the order and reorder it with no coupon.

The 3rd person I talked to said they would issue a refund in the difference of what I initially paid vs what I paid for the reorder. I then waited a few days to see the refunded amount.

I noticed I was shorted just over $28 on the refunded amount a few days later so I called back.

The 4th Levis representative I talked to said that how the 1st person handled the refund was incorrect and they have been with the department for a long time and knew of a better route. Anyways I explained that I was shorted on my refunded amount and that I would like the difference returned back on my credit card. After a long hold and many corrections on basic math (adding, subtracting and percentages) I was told that the refund would be expected in the next 3-5 business days.

After waiting a week I called Levis back today and asked why my refund was talking so long. It appears that the last rep that was so "experienced" hadn't left any notes and further more, did not even put in for a refund. The Levis representative I spoke with was helpful but very rude. She cut me off mid-sentence multiple times. Said she was putting me on hold and didn't even let me finish talking. After the hold she asked for more information on the 1st order that I was matching and I gave her the order number. I asked her if I could give her the figures on what I paid the 1st time, what I paid the 2nd time, and the first refund so that she can calculate the difference to be refunded. She said she would do it her self and was putting me on another hold. After another hold the Levis representative said a refund of $7 would be applied. I told her that the refund was supposed to be $28. I then offered to give her the figures again which she listened to. After another hold she said my additional refund would be applied in 1-2 business days. I asked for a confirmation or reference number and she said her computer froze and wasn't able to provide one. So here I am again waiting.

Anyways here I am typing this massive wall of text to let you know that you've lost a longtime customer. After this hassle with your company I don't feel like shopping Levis and going through your customer service ever again. Great product sold by a company who doesn't care about its customers enough to implement easy exchanges or ordering online through a brick and mortar store .
So I sent a jacket back a little while ago, when will I see a credit on my account ?

As a citizen of North Carolina, I am writing to express my displeasure at your opposition to North Carolina’s HB2 law, specifically your clearly insincere political posturing.  You, along with dozens of other companies signed a letter with the Human Rights Campaign and Equality NC expressing your opposition to the law.  Several of the companies on that letter also have either reversed plans to expand into North Carolina, or threatened to stop doing business here because of HB2.To all of you, I ask this: have you even read the law as it was written?  You say in the letter that “HB 2 is not a bill that reflects the values of our companies, of our country, or even the overwhelming majority of North Carolinians.”  Therefore, I would have to surmise that the values of your company include trampling the rights and safety of the many in order to curry favor with a vocal but in reality tiny minority. I say you are clearly posturing and trying to curry favor for several reasons. Allow me to exemplify one with this question if you genuinely believe in nondiscrimination for all people regardless of race, sex, religion or gender identity, then how long have you had gender neutral bathrooms in your place of business? You claim you are standing up for transgendered individuals.  The fact of the matter is, transgender individuals make up only .3 percent of the US population.  Therefore, the majority of your customers are from the 99.7% of Americans.  It is the money of the 99.7% that keeps your company in business.  I feel betrayed by your urgency to be politically correct, rather than remaining loyal to the families that support your business.  You are not standing up for the majority of your loyal customers. Again, in the letter, you say you pride yourself on being “inclusive and welcoming to all.”  Your opposition to HB2 and bullying the NC legislature with threats does not feel welcoming or inclusive at all. HB2 came to be in order to ensure protection for women and children from potential sexual predators. Charlotte’s city council ordinance would have allowed biological males to share the same restroom, locker and shower facilities as women and children. As a woman and mother, I find the accommodation that puts my safety and my teenage daughter’s safety at risk for the sake of political correctness appalling.I would also warn you to be careful that the tactics you use to bully the state in which I live may be turned against your company when you get on the wrong side of the runaway train of political correctness.Shame on you to those of companies who have threatened to or actually pulled business out of NC.  You say you are doing so because of your deeply held beliefs. You have the freedom to do that, thanks to the laws in place in NC.  That right is the exact one HB2 wants to ensure. I encourage you to rethink your stance on this issue, and understand that in this great country in which we live and do business, people can coexist and still hold differing opinions on various issues.

Fits shoulders and waist and length is fine, but very tight across chest and sleeves are very tight. It's just unwearable and I doubt that the next size would fit either. And that's ok, but the other problem is that I have to pay $7.50 to return the package. This just doesn't seem fair. Luckily, I had free shipping, because if I had paid for shipping your policy is not to refund that either. So in the worst case I would pay $15 to try a jacket that doesn't fit. I'm unwilling to order another size because you won't do an exchange and with a new order I risk more shipping charges if it doesn't fit. This is not a fair policy for selling clothing online! I am completely disappointed with the Levi's online store and cannot recommend it.

FG’s 500,000 JOBS: FINAL TESTS BEGIN TODAY

By Clifford Ndujihe

THE final assessment for over one million Nigerians who applied online for the Federal Government’s 500,000 job scheme for unemployed graduates will begin today.

According to a statement by Laolu Akande, senior special assistant, Media and Publicity, Office of the Vice President, the assessments in the various categories of the N-Power programme will end on October 18.

The N-Power Programme, which is the job creation and empowerment initiative of the Federal Government’s Social Investment Programme, also has programmes for non-graduates. From the assessments, 500,000 job seekers would be picked for the two-year volunteer positions.

According to Akande, candidates will be assessed in phases based on their specific chosen programmes before the final selection.

”Under this phase, applicants are to log in and fill in their phone numbers and surnames as contained in their original application, using their personal profile (which has been opened for every applicant).

In addition, all candidates will be notified by SMS of their assessment the day before. All assessments will include some personal questions and other questions testing basic knowledge of English, General Knowledge and Quantitative Reasoning.

Applicants will also be tested on other programme-specific questions depending on the programme they applied for.

Applicants can take their tests on a smart-phone, tablet, laptop or desktop computer provided that the devices have internet connection.

According to the statement, applicants can only gain access to their profile for assessment as represented in the schedule which breaks down applicants in batches by the first letter in their surnames.

The schedules for the assessments are as follows:

N-Power Teach: September 20 – September – 28, 2016
N-Power Agro: September 29 – October 1, 2016
N-Power Health: October 2 – October 3, 2016
N-Power Community Education: October 4 – October 6, 2016 N-Power Creative: October 7 – October 9, 2016
N-Power Tech (Software): October 10 – October 12, 2016
N-Power Tech (Hardware): October 13 – October 14t, 2016 N-Power Build: October 15 – October 18, 2016

Based on the schedule, applicants for the N-Power Teach programme will be first in line, starting on Tuesday September 20, 2016 and applicants whose surnames fall between the alphabets V-Z are expected to log in and take their assessments on the stipulated dates.

According to the first letter of surnames, the assessments will be held as follows:

BUYER BEWARE - PLEASE REMEBER ONLINE ORDERS MUST BE RETURNED WITHIN 30 DAYS OF PURCHASE NOT PICK UP. I've never been more disappointed with how you work with your customers when they show up at your store or call into your call centre. I recently purchased a sweater and a leather jacket online in small and medium each to make sure I got a good fit. I had bunion surgery in mid-August, so I didn't pick up my packages from the store until about two weeks ago. I totally missed the return policy of 30 days from purchase. I assumed it started from the date of pick up. By the time I was able to walk and get the items, my return and exchange period had passed by 10 days for one and 2 days for the other (not crazy time frames) . DIspite showing up to the store today with everything in never worn condition, tags on, in box, receipt in hand standing in my cast, Zara Eaton Centre staff couldn't make any accommodations seeing as I wasn't some weird scammer. What they did offer was for me was to step to the side to call their customer service desk, but even they were less interested in helping me. The woman on the phone just recited the return policy. Neither the in-store staff of the phone agent offered to make the exception and let me choose some other items that I'd actually wear or give me a store credit much less a seat while a talked to the agent on the phone. Now I have $405 worth of things I'll never wear. I'll never shop there again on principle. Note to Zara head office, sometimes you need to just remember that people are people and life happens. Just because you write something on paper or online doesn't mean you can't make accommodations for those who spend their hard earned money in your stores and aren't trying to scam you. You earn loyalty that way. On a positive note, I did get flowers from the doctor who did my surgery yesterday and he does that for all his patients.

I have been a client, in Portugal, for over twenty years now, and I have to say that I still own some clothes that I bought fifteen years ago, and they are in impecable state. However, in the past eight years or so, I've been noticing that the quality is not the same. Most of the knitwear, the basic cotton t-shirts and coats, don't last more than one season. I literally have to sew new zipers in all the new jeans and dresses I buy, because the original ones are so weak that they stop working after a couple of times. Lucky me, I know how to do it.  I bought a t-shirt two weeks ago and it's already pilling. I have already cut off the labels, so I cannot return it. It's basically trash now. It's really sad, because, as I said, I've been a client for so many years. I feel that, nowadays, it's all about the brand and not the quality.

Sehr geehrtes Zara-Team, 

heute bin ich in Ihrer Filiale in Lübeck, Breite Str., in Sachen Kundenservice schwer enttäuscht worden. 
Ich habe am Fr., 16.09.,  dort drei Jeanshosen für je 25,95 € erstanden,  letztlich demnach 77,85 bezahlt. 
Am Folgetag habe ich die Waschetiketten in den Hosen entfernt,  wie ich das grundsätzlich bei meinen eigenen Hosen tue,  bevor ich sie das erste Mal wasche. Während ich die Hosen auf links drehte,  bemerkte ich,  dass eine unterhalb einer Gürtelschlaufe ein Loch hatte. Offenbar hatte jemand beim Anprobieren der Hose ein bisschen zu heftig daran gezogen. 
Sie fragen sich vielleicht,  weshalb mir dies nicht beim Kauf aufgefallen ist. Diese Frage stellten mir heute auch die beiden Damen an der Kasse,  als ich den Versuch wagte,  die Hose gegen ein intaktes Exemplar umzutauschen. Ich erklärte,  dass ich die schwarze Jeans anprobiert hatte,  und aus Zeitgründen dann die beiden anderen Hosen (davon eine die beschädigte) nicht mehr anzog,  da es sich um die gleichen Modelle,  nur in anderen Farben,  handelte. Ich griff also bei den anderen beiden Hosen nur nach der richtigen Größe und ging so zur Kasse,  ohne die Hosen "unter die Lupe" zu nehmen. 
Ihre Kolleginnen erklärten mir weiter,  man kontrolliere an der Kasse grundsätzlich die Ware,  die das Haus verlasse,  auf Fehler o.Ä. 
Ich bin sicher,  dass dieses Procedere grundsätzlich Anwendung findet. Leider war in meinem Fall eine ziemlich lange Schlange an der Kasse und die kassierende Kollegin arbeitete sehr zügig und hat das Loch offenbar genauso wenig gesehen wie ich. Ich erklärte freundlich,  dass ich die Hose definitiv noch nicht angezogen und das Loch daher nicht selbst verursacht habe. Der Kassenbon belege ja nun auch,  dass die Hose erst kurze Zeit in meinem Besitz war - noch eher zum Untausch zu erscheinen,  war mir aus beruflichen Gründen leider nicht möglich.
Mir wurde von Ihren Mitarbeiterinnen weiterhin erklärt, selbst wenn die Etiketten noch in der Hose befindlich gewesen wären, handele es sich bei dem Loch nicht um einen gültigen Reklamationsgrund,  da man nicht nachvollziehen könne,  wer nun für das Loch verantwortlich sei. So etwas könne aber auch schnell passieren,  da die Hose an der Stelle ja auch "sehr dünn" sei. 

Bei allem Respekt, wenn Sie bei Zara selbst so wenig von der Qualität Ihrer Ware überzeugt sind,  kann ich Ihnen versichern: Ich bin es nun noch weniger und kann sicherlich  nicht behaupten,  dass ich mich als Kundin bei Ihnen gut beraten oder behandelt fühle. Ich betonte auch mehrfach, dass ich kein Geld zurück verlange,  sondern lediglich um den Austausch der beschädigten Jeans gegen ein intaktes Exemplar bitte. Ihre Mitarbeiterinnen kamen mir leider in keiner Weise entgegen. 
Dementsprechend bleibt mir nur das Fazit,  dass weitere Einkäufe meinerseits bei Ihnen nicht mehr erfolgen werden.

Gender blending and unisex clothing is not a new phenomenon - from David Bowie to Cara Delevingne, men have worn women's clothes and vice versa. However, recently this has been increasingly more common, with brands such as ZARA, Selfridges and ALEXANDER WANG, to name a few, creating specific gender neutral lines. Is this just a trend or a larger cultural shift in society?
We went to London Fashion Week to ask people their views.

Unfair and totally inconsiderate treatment by Zara to customers:

Dear Zara 

On the 4th of August, I bought a Trafaluc Denim wear among other items for my wife as birthday present in Zara oxford street branch in first week of august. This was supposed to be a “surprise”, so she did not accompany me to the shop, besides she was looking after a nine month old. On trying all the items, the Trafaluc Denim wear did not fit. I went back to the store in Oxford street for a refund. Now the issue is with the receipt. 

You can understand my shock when I was told by the store staff that there is no refund or exchange without a receipt. In my complete disbelieve, and utter shock, I asked again, only for her to adopt a quite defensive demeanour ‘’I did not make the policy, you have to have your receipt, I am afraid, there are people waiting on the queue”. Without arguments, I went home in search of receipts. I could not find it. I went back the second time, bought more items for my wife, tried to return the previous item explaining that the receipt is not in my house and this is the second time. Not to bore with details but nothing came out of it. Last week Thursday (15th September), I went to buy shorts for my holiday in Spain, paid and tried to return the item the third time. You can now guess how irritated I have become at this point.

I have contacted customer care:
“Dear Edere, 

Thank you for contacting Zara.

In regards to your recent enquiry, please be advised head office have reviewed your case and can confirm that the purchase receipt is required for any exchange or return.

We do apologise for the inconvenience“

“’I did not make the policy, you have to have your receipt, I am afraid…..”, “…We do apologise for the inconvenience…”: what are you afraid for exactly and what are you apologetic about? Are you afraid because you want to force me to waste my hard earned money? Or are you apologetic because you can’t help but be insensitive to your customers? No matter how polite or rude you put it, or what ridiculous reason is behind this policy, it does not stop it from being one step too far this time. 

Now I ask, what is the real motivation behind this complete disregard to your loyal customers. I bought these items as part of an order that included other items. The order is associated with my debit card which I bought them with. I can see it on my bank statement. The Trafaluc Denim wear item is completely traceable through your back office or whatever system you use. Why would you make your customers suffer because of something trivial such as receipt loss when there are ways you can verify the validity of their purchase. These orders are stored in your databases, they are very much accessible to yourselves, there is no denying the truth that my receipt can be reproduced. Why is this option not available to us? Is this not spitting in the face of the very people that have solely made it possible for your business to be where it is today?, that your wages are paid?. How dare you treat us with such rudeness. May I remind you that this is tantamount to biting the very hands that have fed you. There are reasons why the likes of peacocks and bhs have disappeared from our high streets.

This one is a step too far. It is an affront to the very society that have kept you where you. 

One question for you is: if you want me to keep this Trafaluc Denim wear, what do you want my wife to do with it? Add 4 more stones to be able to fit into it? Or perhaps, you suggest that I wear it instead? Or maybe keep it and waste the money? In these hard times? Or are you punishing me because you are worried I may have shoplifted the item? Every of your customer fits the stereotype? What about the fact that this item can be traced with my bank card, and my person validated in case I am fraud? Or are you simply being arrogantly spiteful towards the very customers that have patronised you? Or are you simply taking your loyal customers for granted by coming up with this totally selfish and despicable no receipt, no refund policy? May I remind you that you are in competition with the rest the retailers and all it takes is for this movement to go viral and it will not be long before the advantage you have enjoyed disappears, before you start to hit below your sales targets, before we all go elsewhere. Can you not implement cloud based receipt system and save yourselves the embarrassment of awful customer reviews?

Okay now, I have worked very hard to save money to buy my wife presents and there is no way on this planet that I will allow you to waste my hard earned money. I want my money back.
 
I am only just starting with this. One way or the other, I must find a way to feel not ripped off by Zara.
By ZARA <3

Zara has always been terrible at exchange and refund but I did not know they will get to such poor levels of customer service. I bought a jumper from zara Delhi a few days back. The size was not proper and fit not good so I decided to return it. Today at your phoenix store they tell me that because the tag is removed its not in a saleable condition? I have given them the bill, the tags and it is within 30 days of purchase- plus it didn't fit me so how did the manager Ms Madhuri and the associate Mr kamlesh come to a conclusion that because the tags are not there its not in a saleable condition ? This is absolutely absurd and not expected of a brand like Zara . If you have an exchange/refund policy please accept with returns with grace rather than embarrassing the customer. Really upset about this incident and I wish you apply and brief your staff on international standards for retail!

Hi Zara, love your clothes, but last week I could not exchange a brand new pair of my g/f's pants with an electronic version of the receipt.  I scan and shred ALL my receipts.    My shredded receipts are then donated to the humaine society which uses them for animals.

Whenever I need to return or exchange something with an electronic receipt, I simply produce it at the desk and they either scan the bar code or punch in the number.

BUT Zara, it seems has not caught up to this technological possibilities and do not accept electronic receipts EVEN for a straight exchange.

This is a very very outdated policy.  

My inability to exchange a brand new pair of paints will certainly prevent me from shopping at Zara in the future.

I will certainly miss the clothes.  Perhaps you can save the situation.

MBA Course Details ~ Symbiosis Centre for Management Studies
Why Symbiosis Centre for Management Studies MBA course?
Management education has been the forte of Symbiosis. We have researched and drawn from the experiences of sister institutions to evolve into a multi-functional and adaptable centre for excellence.
Here are some steps that you should take to differentiate different MBA institutes - 
1) MBA course is designed for you to be very intensive in its academic and co-curricular inputs.
2) You should ensures that the essence of the curriculum reaches the students through adoption of a multi-pronged methodology of teaching.
3) Through process-mapping exercises and regular internship opportunities, you are guaranteed international exposure.
4) Long standing commitment to diversity is a mind-set which holds in high regard. The difference in opinions, convictions, economic background, gender & nationality breathes life in campus community while bringing out the best in all students.

OBJECTIVES OF THE Symbiosis Centre for Management Studies:
To build the department as a centre of excellence for imparting high quality management education at the undergraduate level.
To contribute to creation of knowledge by encouraging faculty to engage in research.
To stimulate in students an interest in research and initiate them into research methodologies.
To make education accessible to students across borders of religion, geography, caste or gender.
To foster thinking minds that are sensitive to societal needs and issues thus making them good human beings and responsible members of the society.
To provide an environment that facilitates all-round development of the student personality.

Eligibility for Admission Symbiosis Centre for Management Studies (Indian Students)
Passed XII or equivalent course in any discipline from any recognized Board/Council/University with minimum 50% marks for general (open) category and 45% marks for students of SC and ST category.
Qualifying the Symbiosis Entrance Test (SET), Personal interview & Writing Ability Test of Symbbiosis centre. Indian students will be admitted on the basis of the merit list drawn out of the results of the selection process through SET and PIWAT (SET score 50% and PIWAT 50%)

Call Now @ 9916566036About SIBM PUNE:-
Symbiosis Institute of Business Management, Pune is a premier B-School of India recognized for its excellence in academics, high quality management programme and its valuable contributions to industry, society and students. SIBM Pune was established in 1978. SIBM Pune currently offers the following programs:
• A two years full time MBA programme giving the options to specialize in Marketing, Finance, Operations and Human Resources (Admission through SNAP)
• A two year full time MBA programme in Innovation and Entrepreneurship. (Admission through SNAP)
• Executive MBA programme and One year Post Graduate Diploma Programmes for the working professional offered during the weekends
• Executive Post Graduate Diploma programmes for corporates, as per the requirements of the corporate houses.
~Eligibility criteria-for admission in SIBM PUNE- Graduate from any statutory / recognized university with a minimum of 50% marks (45% for SC/ST) & Valid score in SNAP test.
~Fee structure of SIBM PUNE INCLUDES HOSTEL- 2 years fees of SIBM is 14,50,000 INR for 2016-17 batch.This fees includes the hostel & Mess charges.
~PLACEMENT IN SIBM- Campus Recruitment Programme 2015-16 at SIBM Pune concluded on a high note with record number of job offers secured by students in myriad sectors viz. FMCG/ FMCD, Consulting, E-commerce, BFSI, Telecom, Manufacturing and Technology, Information Technology, Pharmaceutical, Infrastructure, etc.
~OVERVIEW OF MBA PROGRAM- The two-year full-time residential MBA is SIBM Pune’s flagship programme, spread across four semesters and offering specialisations in Marketing, Human Resource Management, Finance and Operations Management. The structure of the programme is designed to give students the best in industry exposure and a nurturing classroom environment, to help them become the leaders of tomorrow, in the specialisation of their choice
~Colleges under SYMBIOSIS INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY FOR MBA
1) SYMBIOSIS INSTITUTE OF BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, {SIBM PUNE} PUNE

Hello everyone ......

חגית שחר :

אם את מניקה ומתחשק לך להיכנס לקנות בזארה- תשקלי שוב!

נכנסתי היום לחנות זארה למחלקת הילדים בקניון עזריאלי במודיעין עם הילדים שלי על מנת לרכוש בגדים לבנים שלי.
הבנים ( בני 7 ו-5) נכנסו לתא המדידה ( היחידי במחלקה) על מנת למדוד את זוגות המכנסיים שבחרנו.
מאחר והמכנסיים היו צרים למטה היה להם קשה למדוד לבד את המכנסיים - אז נכנסתי לתא לעזור להם.
לאחר כמה שניות הבת שלי ( בת שלושה שבועות) התחילה לבכות - התעוררה רעבה. 
הכנסתי אותה לתוך התא, התיישבתי על הכיסא בתא והינקתי אותה. עם היד הפנויה המשכתי לעזור לבנים למדוד. הבן הגדול שלי סיים למדוד ויצא החוצה להניח מחוץ לתא את המכנסיים שלא היו לו טובות. ברגע שפתח את הוילון כדי לצאת המוכרת ראתה שאני מניקה ואמרה לי בגסות: " לא מניקים אצלנו. צאי מתא המדידה". ניסיתי להסביר לה שאני עוזרת לבן שלי למדוד מכנסיים, ושהילדה בוכה מרעב, והיא בשלה- לא מניקים פה. היא אף הגדילה לומר " לכי לשירותים הציבוריים של הקניון ותניקי שם".
חשוב לי להבהיר: אף לקוח לא עמד בתור להיכנס לתא המדידה, הייתי מכוסה בחיתול, לא היו גברים באזור.
יצאתי מהתא וניגשתי למנהלת המשמרת שהייתה קרירה ואדישה ואמרה שאלו הנהלים בזארה.
התקשרתי למוקד שירות הלקוחות ומי שענתה לי הזדעזעה מהיחס כלפי, ביקשה שאמתין על הקו והתקשרה לסניף לברר. כשחזרה לקו כבר ענתה אחרת ואמרה שאלו הנהלים.

מנהלי זארה היקרים, יש לכם עוד המון מה ללמוד.
תעלו קומה ותראו איך חנויות כמו דלתא, CELIO( חנות בגדי גברים) וקסטרו ילדים הגיבו לבקשתי להניק: הביאו כיסא לפינה שקטה בשמחה ואפילו שאלו אם אני רוצה כוס מים.

מיותר לציין שלא קניתי שם. כנראה שגם לא אשוב לקנות.

Dear customer service, 
My name is Rama Abu Goush and I've been a ZARA customer for years. I had a theft problem in ZARA two days ago. 
I was in the fitting room trying some clothes on. I had a ZARA bag with me theta had an overall that I got from ZARA Germany just recently and a sash from a new Michael Kors bag that I got. Before going into the fitting room, I've asked the employee where I should put the bag, and she told me to place it outside the fitting room as it isn't allowed to have any bags in. However, when I went out of the fitting room, I couldn't find my bag and just found a bag that contained ZARA heels in it. After a lot of negotiation, the employees told me to take the heels that were worth 90JDs and wait until tomorrow and maybe then the woman who took my bag would have it returned and if not, I can't return the heels and buy with that money. Nevertheless, I had in my bag a Michael Kors bag's sash which costed me 250JDs and an overalls which were worth 70JDs (which they don't even have in Jordan). Meaning that what I had in there was worth so much more than the 90JDs heels. 
Nevertheless, I came in the next day as they said and had my second shock. The heels that they told I can refund and buy with the money worth it weren't even bought and were on hold! Meaning that I don't even have those 90JDs to buy with! I've then asked to see the cameras and they refused. 
I have no idea what kind of customer service is this. I've been a ZARA customer for over 7 years and this is how you treat your loyal customers? I am extremely frustrated as now I don't even have a EID outfit. I would also like to mention how unprofessional their customer care was! Other than their attitude, they weren't helpful at all and all they did was give me your Lebanese number and your email. 
I would just like to point out that ZARA is a well known, international shop and i would have never expected such a treatment. If they could t keep a bag at their own property, they shouldn't take it in the first place. 
Now I don't have an outfit to wear for Eid and the people that works in Zara were very mean and they didn't do anything they just gave a number in Lebanon and an email to contact with them. 
Zara it's an international shop and if they can't keep the plastic bag at the first place, they shouldn't have not let me take it in with me.
Thank you,
Rama Abu Gosh

Ik heb een pyjama bij jullie gekocht met voetjes en deze gisteren voor mijn zoon aangetrokken. Nadat hij een tijdje had gespeeld ging hij hangen aan de salontafel en huilen.  Wij dachten dat hij zich had bezeerd. Wij hebben hem toen lang moeten knuffelen want hij bleef huilen. Nadat wij hem in bed hadden gedaan moesten wij er in de nacht nog uit omdat hij huilde. Wij maar denken dat hij onrustig was omdat hij zijn speen niet had. Vanochtend werdt hij krijsend wakker. Wij hem weer sussen en een papfles gegeven. Toen ik hem neergezet wilde zetten om te gaan spelen tilde hij zijn voet op. Ik schrok en dacht hij heeft zijn voetje verstuikt eb knoopte gelijk de pyjama open om naar zijn voet te kijken en tot mijn grote schrik zat er een achterkant van een alarm in zijn voet. Daar heeft hij dus de hele avond en nacht dus mee gezeten. Zijn voet is rood en opgezet en heb het gedesinfecteerd en hij kan er niet meer op lopen. ik ben geschokt dat dit kan. Dit zat dus al die tijd nog in zijn pyjama en uiteindelijk is hij erop gaan staan. Ik vindt dit echt niet kunnen. Dit is ontzettend gevaarlijk. Ik bestel geregeld mijn kleding bij Zara en ben dus ook echt geschrokken en vreselijk  teleurgesteld in de Zara. Ik zal de foto's toevoegen en ik hoop op een spoedige reactie.

Venho aqui hoje desabafar com minha tamanha indignação em relação ao tamanho constrangimento que passei hoje a noite na loja Zara no shopping Dom Pedro em Campinas.Entrei por volta das 19h e 30minutos na loja para comprar roupas para meu filho,estávamos eu e meu marido no provador quando percebi que havia esquecido o óculos do meu filho na loja ao lado,pois bem deixei eles no provador e fui buscar,quando retornei havia um rapaz na porta parado com ela parcialmente fechada.Pedi licença e o avisei que meu esposo e filho estavam lá dentro a minha espera para efetuar o pagamento e ele disse pra mim com um tom extremamente arrogante que eu não poderia entrar, mas...eu fiquei pasma!!!e disse a ele que se eu fosse comprar eu poderia entrar?e ele disse - que também não!!!horrorizados os clientes que estavam na fila do caixa me disseram que era para eu reclamar com o gerente...pasmem!!!!!!o rapaz juntamente com uma moça se identificaram como gerentes,a moça por sua vez representou ser muito pior que o rapaz dizendo que eu não deveria reclamar nada com eles e completou afirmando que AQUELA LOJA NÃO ERA MEU LUGAR,pois bem,racismo é crime!!!estou aqui para alertar a todos para que não passem pelo que vivenciei ali junto com meu filho de 8 anos que me perguntou porque a gente não podia entrar na loja, quando me retirei da loja os dois ''gerentes'' continuaram falando da minha pessoa!Estou aqui para afirmar que com a denuncia juntamente com o Procon vou solicitar o vïdeo e assim entrar com um processo contra a Zara pois ato de hoje é claramente um *crime e dizer que através de todos os meios irei divulgar o comportamento desses dois indivíduos que praticaram esse ato.Não podemos nos calar com esse comportamento abusivo de pessoas que julgam as outras por sua aparência,suas roupas,sua cor...é realmente muito triste e desesperador.Mas não ficarão impunes!

Dear Zara, 
It seems that I am the next customer from a huge list of disappointed customers. A few months ago I bought a blouse which had a small tore by one shoulder after two days of wearing. After a discussion in the store, the storemanager offered me a new blouse. With suspicious care I tried on the new blouse at home, the tags were still on. After one day the seam was very weak, showed a run and I decided not to wear the blouse before it tore again. I went back to the store and the storemanager neglected my complaint, didn't want to compensate me at all. I got very upset by this. How is it possible that a blouse is tearing after one or two days wearing?! The blouse was more expensive than the average price of Zara clothes (40 euros), so I was at least expecting a little more quality for the price I paid. After calling with the headoffice, Zara told me to buy a new piece of clothing within six months, they were not able to pay me back even when the tags were still on the blouse and I was within the time limit for returning. For now my trust in Zara's quality and customer care has reached the bottom line. According to Dutch law I send a letter to terminate the contract because of default. An email with a confirmation of receiving the letter was send three weeks ago. Again my complaint is being neglected. Zara does not want to take any responsibility for the quality they deliver and asks prices that are not reasonable for this quality of clothes and customer care. Since I am not the first person complaining on this page (it seems like Zara is in default by its customers worldwide), I hope Zara will take steps towards its customer satisfaction and starts with compensating and taking responsibility. They are far behind with this comparing to other stores.

Zara requested me to go to the store, collect it then process the refund, even though I said it's not convenience for me to go, as the store is far away. 

Compared to other shops like Topshop, I get refunds back automatically  if I don't collect the order within 15 days. 

Please improve your customer service. I don't think I want to buy anything from Zara after this problem.

If you never want to see your money again, order from here. Most stringent return/exchange policies I've ever seen. 30 days EXACTLY from the day you place your order do you have to exchange or return. After that, nothing. So you lose about 7-10 returnable days just waiting for your package to arrive. If heaven forbid, like myself, your package fails to be delivered and you leave for vacation, you are out of luck. Zara will just tell you that you a) should have waited to pick it up or b) mailed your return back from your house (aka the one you are physically not at because you are away). Wouldn't even issue a gift card which would have to be spent at their store anyways. Did I mention this occurred a mere few DAYS after their strict ass month policy? (Order placed July 29th, Attempted to return on August 31st) I'll be shopping at H&M instead where they seem to still have a pulse.

Hello Zara, me again. I'm sorry you have chosen to terminate our relationship in such an abrupt manner, I really miss our daily emails.  Perhaps we could put the fizz back in to our communications by using Facebook? As they say, a change is as good as a rest. Just to recap, in case you've forgotten, I purchased a pair of shoes from you on line. I loved those shoes, I adored them. It was shoe heaven. Unfortunately, when they arrived, they showed signs of having been worn and the leather was quite creased, although the label was intact.When I stopped crying over such a life changing disaster, I returned the shoes to you. It was lovely to hear from you when you rang me and it was the start of a very special relationship I thought. The phone call I made to you on 28th July at 16:32 where I discussed the shoes with your lovely call handler was resolved. You would issue a refund. Thank you. All sorted, or so I thought. You obviously liked the sound of my voice and chose to put in several further phone calls to me. When I got chance to ring you back, you told me there was no record of a refund being agreed. Anyway, I'll get to the point. After many email exchanges it appears you 'have no record' of my phone call to you on July 28th at 16.32. Very strange as you record all your calls. I did help you out by sending you a photo of my phone showing the details of the call. Our relationship was going through a turbulent stage, and you dumped me by sending back the shoes. I won't lie to you Zara, I was very upset by you ending our relationship so abruptly. Still, I don't want to be one of those bitter and twisted exes but would like to say this, under the nice new Consumer Rights Act (2015) our as I like to call it our 'Pre Nup' you have to offer a full refund if the goods purchased are faulty. Which they were. We both know that and I know its hard to move on after the ending of a relationship, Zara, but hey, the laws on my side and I really think you need to check your phone records again to find ouot phone call. An apology would also be nice and we can part amicably. Hoping my heartfelt letter to you lasts longer than 25 seconds on your glossy page and that you haven't moved on from me already. Because, after all, you need to learn from 'us' in order to treat future relationships you may have with respect.
Take care Zara
With my best wishes 
Heidi

Reklamation!!!

Auch wir konnten über den "normalen Weg" einer Email keine Hilfe finden. Haben in Düsseldorf eine Bluse gekauft, auf dem Heimweg von Holland. Zuhause bemerkten wir, dass unter den aufgekrempelten Ärmeln ein "goldener Knopf" fehlte. Ich habe über das Kontaktformular an Zara geschrieben, bekam eine Antwort, 
"bitte wenden Sie sich an contakt.de@zara.com" - dies habe ich heute erledigt, verschiedene Fotos der Email beigfügt (auch Kassenbon) und bekommt schon wieder als Antwort "bitte rufen Sie an...!!!" - nicht gerade nett und professionell.

Somit habe ich jetzt telefonischen Kontakt aufgenommen und bin keineswegs mit der Antwort zufrieden.

Ich müsste in eine Filiale gehen und dort reklamieren. Jedoch finde ich es nicht okay - und hier liegt eindeutig ein Fehler aus Ihrem Unternehmen vor - dass ich die Bluse nur in einer Filiale umtauschen kann. Wir waren auf dem Heimweg von Holland und sind noch über die "Kö" shoppen gegangen. Uns sowie der Dame an der Kasse ist der fehlende Knopf leider nicht aufgefallen. Die Ärmel waren hochgekrempelt.

Nunmehr muss ich wegen eines fehlenden Knopfes, den ich eigentlich nur nachfordern wollte und auch bereit war, die Portokosten zu übernehmen, finanzielle Unkosten auf mich nehmen, um diesen Makel auszugleichen.

Diese Vorgehensweise finde ich ehrlich gesagt total Kunden unfreundlich!!!

Hochachtungsvoll

Simone Jahn

Really poor show by Zara UK.

Just went to get a satchel bag in your Maidstone branch and selected one marked 35.95, great!

As I approach the till I notice the price is in Euro, which is not unusual for you guys.  So I thought, great it will be slightly less than that in Pounds.

The girl at the till scanned it in an to my complete surprise it came up at £39.99!!! When I questioned she apologised and said we will mark it down the £35.95 which I accepted.

When Manager Veronica came over, she abruptly said she would not reduce the price, and the reason it was more expensive was due to shipping costs..... In rough numbers you're saying it costs about £8 a bag to post, who is running you logistics operations!?!?!?

Veronica said the till girl was wrong to offer a price reduction (bit humiliating for the girl), and did I want the bag or not as she would/could not agree to reduce the price as marked.

As the manager was quite stand offish and with a queue forming behind me I decided to buy the bag and make a quick exit (which was not so quick as a tag was left on the bag meaning I had to make my back into the store to have deactivated).

Certainly not a good experience, and will make me think twice of whether to bother buying in Zara in future!

【BÍ KÍP KINH DOANH ONLINE trên FACEBOOK】 – 【Thời gian là vàng bạc, đừng phí nó vào việc đăng bài thủ công lên nhóm】
.
⭐️ Đăng bài lên nhóm facebook là cách ĐƠN GIẢN, HIỆU QUẢ và ÍT TỐN KÉM nhất khi kinh doanh online trên facebook.
.
👉 Nếu bạn đăng thủ công thì tốc độ nhanh nhất (đối với người đã có kỹ năng đăng bài thủ công lên nhóm cực tốt) thì phải mất 1 tiếng để đăng được vào tối đa 60 Groups, đăng xong cũng hoa mắt chóng mặt. Và một ngày chỉ đủ sức đăng được 1 lần như thế. Nếu bạn dùng #udlamgiau , bạn chỉ mất 1 phút để đăng 720 Groups một ngày hoặc đăng vài nghìn Groups nếu bạn cho chạy đồng thời nhiều tài khoản.
.
👉 Nếu bạn đăng thủ công thì lúc ăn, ngủ, đi ra ngoài, … nó trở thành “thời gian chết” trong quỹ thời gian kinh doanh của bạn. Nhưng nếu có @udlamgiau thì vấn đề đó sẽ được giải quyết triệt để.
.
👉 Sự khác biệt là rất lớn, nhưng chỉ mất chưa tới 1.000Đ/ngày để nâng khả năng tiếp cận khách hàng của bạn lên một tầm cao mới. Bù lại, nhờ tiếp cận được với nhiều người, những người có nhu cầu về sản phẩm của bạn cũng tìm được tới bạn nên số lượng đơn hàng sẽ tăng lên. Chỉ 1 – 3 đơn hàng gia tăng đã giúp bạn đủ trả chi phí cả năm rồi, thời gian còn lại là lúc nó mang lại lợi nhuận cho bạn. Mà hơn thế, nhờ @udlamgiau lượng khách hàng tiềm năng vẫn liên tục gia tăng.
.
👉 Thay vì cắm mặt vào máy tính hay smartphone để đăng bài và chấm chấm ở comment mới có khách hỏi hàng, thì ăn cũng có khách hỏi, ngủ cũng có khách hỏi, chơi cũng có khách hỏi mua hàng…
.
👉 Đầu tư một tài khoản @udlamgiau chỉ với 360k/năm để có thể chạy đăng bài ngay cả khi tắt máy và có thể sử dụng trên tất cả các thiết bị với việc mua một phần mềm vài triệu mà khi nào bật máy phần mềm mới hoạt động thì bạn sẽ chọn cái nào???
.
👉 Chi phí 360k/năm hoạt động, tính ra chưa tới 1.000Đ/ngày, trong khi nhờ ứng dụng, bạn chỉ cần bán được thêm một đơn hàng là bù đắp được gấp cả trăm lần phí dùng ứng dụng của ngày hôm đó, chưa nói tới việc nhờ ứng dụng mà có thể tăng 10 – 30 đơn hàng 1 ngày. Một sự đầu tư quá lợi!!!
.

Byłam dziś w jednym ze sklepów w Warszawie - przymierzyłam sukienkę, była dobra, ale niestety była na szwie rozdarta. Panie obsługujące przymierzalnię sprawdziły, że w tym rozmiarze są jeszcze dwie. Zasugerowały, że jak mi zależy to mam sobie poszukać na wieszakach. Poszłam, znalazłam. Była tylko jedna sztuka i miała dokładnie takie samo rozdarcie ( niedokładne przeszycie na szwie). Przyszłam z tą sukienką do przymierzalni - Panie odesłały mnie do kasy, abym porozmawiała z Managerem i otrzymam upust za wadę. Poszłam do kasy. Pani przy kasie mnie wręcz wyśmiała. Rzuciła sukienkę do pudła i oświadczyła że towar wybrakowany odsyłają do zakładu...Nie ma szansy na żaden upust. Sukienka kosztowała 199 zł i miała wadę taką, że trudno było by samemu to ładne zszyć - upust ok 30 - 40 zł spowodowałyby że sukienkę bym kupiła i była zachwycona empatią ekspedientek, a sklep polecałabym koleżanką. A tak - macie niezadowoloną klientkę. A na koniec najlepsze - sukienka była po południu wystawiona znów jako pełnowartościowy towar w sklepie! Ktoś  się  nabierze. Tyle razy robiłam u Państwa niemałe zakupy dla siebie i dzieci - nie rozumiem takiego podejścia do klienta, a już wywieszenie tego towaru....dla mnie nie uwierzenia.

ZARA Brasil venho relatar um absurdo referente ao NÃO atendimento de troca que obtive na Zara BH Shopping (Belo Horizonte/ MG).

Relato: Tenho um filho (baby) foi PRESENTEADO com uma calça jeans baby sarouel de 3/6 meses, porém não serve (nem entram) nas "coxas" (pernas) do baby, ele tem "coxas" grossa, com isso a calça não entrou nele com 3 meses, fui tentar a troca e a mesma me informou que já passou de 30 DIAS para a TROCA, lembro que foi PRESENTE, ou seja, a pessoa que presenteou não sabia como meu filho ia engordar ou se alimentar!

Um ABSURO não efetuar a troca!
Não se tem como saber se o bebê irá conseguir vestir a roupa sem que esteja no mês indicado na peça!

Fora o péssimo atendimento da loja BH. O presente foi adquirido na loja Zara Iguatemi Sorocaba (SP) isso consta na etiqueta. O produto esta sem uso e com etiquetas devidamente sem retirar ou mexer na peça!

Vocês deviam COMUNICAR perfeitamente que presentes também tem prazo de troca, ou NÃO VENDER sem adequar as peças a babys padrão BRASIL.

Hello,

I want to report my unpleasant experience I had with Zara stores in Frankfurt.
It actually happened last month.
I thought it wasn't worth to write about at first.
But I was writing about racism experiences I have faced as an Asian woman living in Europe, and thought this particular one might need your attention.

So here it goes.

It was in the store in Frankfurt Konstablerwache. When I made the purchase, the cashier didn't give me the receipt directly onto my hand. I thought she might have put it in the bag with the clothes because they do that sometimes.
The queue was very long, and I didn't want to waste other customers' time, so I stepped aside the queue and went through the bag to make sure that I wasn't mistaken about not getting the receipt.
The receipt wasn't there, so I went back to the cashier and told her that she hadn't given me the receipt. 
Apparently she was very annoyed and asked me to double-check my pulse. I did so in front of her. It wasn't there of course because she never gave it to me.
She told me angrily that next time, if I don't get the receipt, I'd have to tell them immediately. I told her that I thought she might have put it in the bag, but she cut me talking and said "No, No.No."
She gave me a new receipt with no prices on, but said it shouldn't be a problem to return or exchange.

About a week later, I went to another Zara store in Frankfurt Hauptwache. I picked up some new clothes and wanted to return some clothes I bought before. When the cashier here saw my receipt, she seemed a bit confused and upset because there was no prices on. She spoke to her colleague, and this colleague explained her some stuff. Now they both looked quite annoyed, then asked me if I had the master card I had used to pay for the 1st purchase with me. I said I did and showed it to them. But they went "Are you sure? This is the card?" I said yes, and then they asked again "100% sure?"
I said yes again. I felt like I'm some sort of credit card thief? I tried to explain them what happened at my earlier purchase and the receipt but they weren't listening but just speaking to each other in German.
Finally all the process seemed to be almost done. Now they needed my signature on some kind of return receipt. At this moment, an old Chinese lady came to the cash desk and put her stuff on it. I guess she thought I was done there. Okay. It was rude of her to not wait for her turn and just expected to have her stuff checked out like that. But what's even more rude was that the cashier pushed the lady's arms off the cash desk without saying anything but only with the very annoyed face. Like she's not even a person. I mean, the cashier could've just said something like "Please wait on the queue." Is it too crazy to do that?

Maybe it's just me overthinking, but I feel like if I were white, this wouldn't have happened. I mean, cutting while I talk, never saying sorry, blaming me, and making me feel like a thief.
 
If it wasn't anything to do with racism, then you probably want to consider training your staff to be less rude in general.

I'm sorry for such long post and thank you for taking your time and reading.

Thanks.

Complaint!

Order Date 12-8-2016 , we had ordered online at ZARA Netherlands, 16 garments worth € 117.60, of which 3 pieces were missing from the box !!!

These were well described on the list and are paid for!!!

The Customer Service of ZARA is hard to find. 
We called up to 3 times, with customer service by phone: 0800 020 16 58.
After each phone call, they said they will contact back within 24 hours with us what they didn’t.  
While our email address and telephone number were known to them.

We were told that they were going to investigate it and will contact the headquarters of ZARA.

The box was sealed with plastic and the clothes were all neatly folded, but where are my three garments that are not delivered!!!

In short, this is a "mistake" of ZARA , and I would like to have delivered the missing three garments!

To whom it may concern,

I am writing in to lodge an official complaint on today's Yeezy 350 V2 launch happening at your adidas Originals store located within Pavilion Mall, KL. I trust the upper management of adidas Malaysia will look into this complaint officially and seriously, and I demand a speedy response from your good office. Please kindly take note that without an acceptable response from your good office, I would raise the case to the National Consumer Complaints Centre (NCCC) and Federation of Malaysian Consumers Associations (FOMCA).

Just to provide an overview of what happened since as early as 5AM in the morning. A line started right in front of the main entrance of Pavilion Mall by the Hibiscus Fountain, with your loyal customers lining up as early as before 5AM in the morning. I reached and joined the queue at approximately 7.45AM, with about 250-300 people lining up in front of me. The first few in the queue was told by the security guards that it was the "official queue" for your Yeezy 350 V2 ballot tickets.

At approximately 9.30AM, hundreds of people rushed in to the front of your retail store from all different routes and entrances. Those at the first 100-200 in the line were dumb founded, only to realise their effort to start queuing were futile. Hence, there was no more queue, only chaos.

To be fair to the management, it could not be considered 'wrong' for not providing the consumers a proper queue system. However, this is surely a case of mismanagement, since adidas Malaysia had done launching and balloting for various Yeezy's and NMD's since nearly 2 years ago. We as consumers have sufficient reasons to believe that, by now, adidas Malaysia should have known how to better manage the frantic crowd.

Now let me raise the most unacceptable clear cut case of consumer mistreatment.

The ballot ticket registrationwas delayed for only 5 minutes, and started at 10.05AM. However, upon approaching your store manager and retail staffs of adidas Originals @ Pavilion 3 times, I could not be given a simple answer for a simple question - "What is the total number of ballot tickets available for the Yeezy 350 V2 launching this Saturday?"

Your store manager first told me that the ballot ticket registration is supposed to be managed by a 'Third Party' which happened to be late for the registration. Upon further questioning, only to realise that the 'Third Party' she claimed is actually a team from adidas Malaysia HQ. She promised to call me back upon speaking to her 'HQ' to inform the number of ballot tickets available.

Your store manager kept her promise and called me back after approximately 20 minutes, from the retail store's landline - 03-2141 8198. Unfortunately, she gave me no answer, only to quote her 'HQ' for saying "the number of ballot tickets available cannot be revealed".

Hence, kindly enlighten me a question that your store manager failed to answer on behalf of her company. Why is the number of ballot tickets available for the Yeezy 350 V2 raffle not allowed to be announced to the consumers queuing for the tickets? We were not asking for the number to be disclosed a day before, an hour before or 10 minutes before. The registration for ballot tickets had already started, and yet the long queue of consumers were made to queue and wait for their ticket which they have no idea if they could obtain.

How many skipped school? How many called in their office for MC or Emergency Leave? Have some empathy on the consumers who paid for your operational costs and your salaries please.

I am very unsatisfied with your lack of management on simple activity / event coordination, the consumers deserve to be treated with dignity, so does your retail team members. Please do not put so much unnecessary stress and anxiety on your retail crew and the poor consumers.

An email of the same content had been sent to all members of management a moment ago. Your kind response is highly appreciated.

Regards,

Sebastian

Leute...An die Stifte - fertig ---Los----teilen erlaubt!

..

Hallo zusammen

Es geht um meinen Sohn Leon. Leon wird am 19.09 12 Jahre alt und ist Autist. er ist ein unheimlich freundlicher, fröhlicher und sozialer Junge, mit Interesse für Landwirtschaft/ Traktoren und Mario/Luigi (Nintendo Charakthere). Jedoch für sein Alter noch sehr verspielt und noch nicht entsprechend entwickelt, was das Spielverhalten betrifft. 

Leon lud vor Wochen einige seiner bisher engeren Freunde zu seinem Geburtstag ein, der entweder eine Schatzsuche hätte werden sollen oder ein Tag in einem Indoor Spielplatz. 

leider haben alle anderen Kinder abgesagt. 
 Einige mit der Anfrage, ob man nicht mal zum Bowlen oder zum Laserteck gehen könnte...dafür interessiert Leon sich aber noch nicht.

Letzten Endes feiert Leon seinen Geburtstag dieses Jahr ausschließlich im Kreise seiner Familie, was er natürlich sehr zu schätzen weiß, jedoch fehlt ihm der altersgerechte Anschluß...

er ist dieses Jahr unheimlich traurig, weil er der Ansicht ist, daß mit ihm etwas nicht stimmt, weil sich die Kinder von ihm Abwenden und scheinbar nichts mehr mit ihm anfangen können.

er gibt sich selbst die Schuld, zweifelt viel an sich und ist zur Zeit in einer schwierigen Phase des Selbstzweifels, was mich als Mutter unheimlich traurig macht und mir lange überlegt habe, wie wir Leon an seinem Geburtstag eine besondere Freude machen könnten.

Es sollte nichts mit materiellem zu tun haben, sondern etwas für das Herz sein, etwas besonderes. 

Da Leon ein..für einen Jungen seines Alterns außergewöhnliches Hobby entwickelt hat, kam mir dazu die passende Idee..

Leon sammelt und liebt schöne Postkarten. 

Darum habe ich mir als seine Mutter, die eigentlich eher sehr introvertiert ist...die Idee und den Aufruf rausgenommen, hiermit im sozialen Netzwerk an die Öffentlichkeit zu gehen und viele Menschen zu erreichen...mit der Bitte...falls sie eine Postkarte übrig hätten...Leon vielleicht einen Geburtstagsgruß mit ein paar lieben Worten zu senden...

Somit bekommt er Post von vielen Menschen, die er nicht kennt/ die ihn nicht kennen..denen er es aber trotz alledem Wert ist, sích die kleine Mühe zu machen, meinem Sohn ein Lächeln ins Gesicht zu zaubern und ihn davon zu überzeugen, daß er es für all die Menschen Wert ist...weil er wirklich ein einzigartiger, besonderer Junge ist, der es verdient hat, daß es Menschen gibt, die seinen Geburtstag mit einer kleinen Geste der Nächsteliebe bereichern....

Post ginge somit an : Stichwort " : Geburtstagsaktion für Leon Röhl"
 Unser Lädchen / 53560 Vettelschoß...

( Eine Straße oder Hausnummer ist noch notwendig, da Unser Lädchen die Postannahmestelle ist)

Im Vorhinein bedanke ich mich ganz herzlich für die Anteilnahme bei jedem Einzelnen, der sich bereit erklärt, meinem Sohn diese Freude zu erweisen. Herzlichsten Dank! Stefanie Prange

Adidas Originals und Rita Ora präsentieren das neue Color Paint Pack. Zwei Jahre nach der ersten Collabo zwischen Adidas und Rita Ora, kommt jetzt wieder eine neue Synergie aus Kreativität und Attitüde der beiden Größen. Die brandneue adidas Originals x Rita Ora Kollektion besticht durch florale Muster und einzigartige Details. Malen nach Zahlen ist das Motto! Kaleidoskopisch anmutende Linien und blumige Camouflage Muster auf den klassischen, schlichten Schnitten der Adidas Ikonen! Mit dem Rita Ora Color Pack begibst du dich mit dem Retro Trend auf eine Reise in deine farbenfrohe Kindheit! Durch ein überdimensionales Blütenmeer tauchst du ein in eine bunte Fantasiewelt! Der Look des sonst cleanen weißen Stan Smith, wird bei dieser Version zur von Malen nach Zahlen inspirierten Leinwand! Das Upper ist ein klassisches weißes Leder, mit den perforierten 3-Stripes und steht auf einer weißen Cup-Sohle. Der Sockliner kommt im bereits ausgefüllten, bunten Malen nach Zahlen Look! Mach dir deine Sneaker Welt, wie sie dir gefällt!

I bought my fourth pair of SAMBA shoes about 4 months ago. This shoe has been my go-to casual shoe for years but I have been completely discouraged by my most recent pair. I've become completely fed up with wearing them because of the continued squeak they make with every step I take. This was never an issue with the first three pairs I bought (maybe a slight squeak the first couple days but certainly not persisting beyond that). I was even going to the extreme of applying a daily coat of talcum powder between the tongue and the rest of the shoe to try to silence them but it has gotten to the point where I no longer have the patience to continue this ridiculous routine. Have I a bought a defective pair or are all new SAMBA models prone to this annoyance? I asked the store where I bought them what I could do and they said there was nothing they could do. I wouldn't recommend Adidas shoes after this frustrating experience.

Investieren Sie für ein Projekt der Erneuerbaren Energien und Profitieren Sie und die Natur in einer neuen Zukunft der Strom Erzeugung von unserer neu entwickelten Technologie der Erneuerbaren Energien ein ganzes Leben lang!

Unser Ziel ist es, die gesamte Welt dieser Umweltfreundlichen Erneuerbaren Energie Technologie Teil haben zu lassen, mit den Minimum an kosten die je möglich sind, um Energie zu Gewinnen und angemessen vergleichbar wie ein Kraftwerk Strom zu Produzieren.

Für diese neue Technologie muss eine Zeitnahe Umsetzungen und Bekanntgabe erfolgen.

Dafür benötigen wir mit dem zu gründenden Unternehmen my-profit.de Geld für rechtliche Sicherungen, Homepage Veröffentlichung und die dazu führende Technologie Veröffentlichung sowie dessen zeitliche Umsetzung!
Es muss eine Zeitnahe Umsetzungen mit dieser Technologie für Ihren Profit erfolgen!

Damit jedes Existente Energie nutzende Element auf dieser Erde davon im großen maß Profitieren kann.

Das erste Projekt wird in Deutschland Beginnen.

Aus rechtlichen Gründen können wir unsere Technologie noch nicht veröffentlichen daher bitten wir um Verständnis und bitten zugleich um Vertrauen und Unterstützung für dieses Projekt.

Sie werden von diesem Projekt für Ihre Unterstützung Profitieren.
Wenn Sie helfen ist das möglich und jeder einzelne von Ihnen zählt, dann können wir evtl. schon im Jahr 2019 mit Profit Strom zu unseren Partnern Liefern!

Werden Sie mit Ihrer Spende automatisch zum Partner des Unternehmens von my-profit.de und Erhalten Sie die Möglichkeit bis zu 90 % Profit Kosten Ersparnis für Energie, Ihr Leben lang ab Beginn der Vernetzung des Unternehmens zu Erhalten.

Hierfür brauchen wir lediglich bei erfolgreichem Projekt einen, Spenden Nachweis für Ihre persönliche Spende an uns, wie z. B. einem Konto Auszug oder der Bestätigungs- E-Mail die Sie nach Ihrer Spende von Leetchi.com erhalten!

Nach erfolgreichem Projekt Start und nach Überprüfung der Spenden und Unterstützungen wird Ihnen Zugang zu den Angeboten der Möglichkeiten für Strom bis zu 90 % Sparen zu können Ihnen angewährt und zugesichert.

Wir Benötigen Kapital um diese Technologie zeitnah rechtlich zu Sichern, Perfekt zu Designen und dadurch eine Volumen reiche Produktion zu erschaffen und alle notwendigen Maßnahmen vollziehen zu können wie auch das Unternehmen my-profit.de erfolgreich zu Etablieren mit Sitz in Deutschland und die Visionen Profit für jeden mit Beginn in Deutschland mit der Produktion wie auch dessen Lieferung auch zeitnah Beginnen zu können benötigt dieses Projekt Unterstützung von jeden einzelnen dem dieses Projekt gefällt.

Today I visited the spring street location looking for a pair of sneakers. As I was browsing I didn't see sneakers I liked but I did see a read track jacket that I loved. There were only two large jackets displayed so I asked an associate for some help. The associate was happy to assist and the only one in the store who seemed so. Unfortunately, they were out of my size. I went to the fitting room to try on a few other items and when leaving the fitting room I went to hand my items to the associate (working the fitting room) my unwanted items (which I hung myself as I also work in retail) and the associate put his hands up and said, "You can put it back yourself". I was a bit in shock because generally associates working fitting room areas would take your items. He proceeded to tell other clients to hang and run items to the floor themselves. A few minutes later I then ask if it would be possible to place an order in store to be shipped to my home. I was told no but I could, "do it myself online". No alternative options were given to check another store or anything. I was really disappointed in the customer service as I would expect something more from such a responsible and well known company. Working in retail is by no means an easy job, I will be the first to admit. However, the front runners of a company are the retail workers and it seemed as though business and customers were not first priority. I found the Broadway location with my size in the items I wanted with great help at the register. But asking customers to put things back themselves, and not assisting in doing everything they can to make a sale just seems a little odd to me.

Hola buenas tardes, tengo el siguiente problema: 

Necesito realizar nota de crédito de unas zapatillas que la abuela de mi hija Compro el día 28/08/2016 y por mala "información" del vendedor al momento de comprar que le dijo que era talla pequeña, ella confió de buena fe y las compro luego llego a la casa y las zapatillas no que le quedaron buenas a mi hija, fueron de inmediato a la tienda en mall plaza la serena, pero no habían tallas más pequeñas del modelo, mostraron alternativas que no se parecían en nada a lo que ella eligió en primera instancia, mi sra. Pidió nota de crédito pero se negaron en hacer la devolución ya que por políticas de "Adidas" no les harían nota de crédito, que eso estaba informado en el ticket adjunto a la boleta, un poco irrisorio ya que el ticket sale posterior a la compra y eso no fue informado antes de comprar, entonces les mostraron un cartel con sus políticas que está detrás del mesón de atención y que además en ese momento estaban tapadas con unas cajas de otras zapatillas, mi sra. Un poco molesta por la situación levanto un poco la voz y la encargada de tienda en ese momento no tuvo mejor idea que llamar a los guardias de mall plaza, ósea que más puedo decir muy mala Atención de parte de los encargados que indicaron de manera déspota que además ella no había sido la que compro y que no tenían porque hablar con ella, que por nada no harían la nota de crédito y que se dirigieran al sernac (muy ético de su parte), más encima mi sra. Pregunto cuando llegarían modelos nuevos y le indicaron que fuera a la tienda a revisar ella, que no tenían fecha de llegada de productos, que podía ser entre un mes, dos meses... 
yo hoy fui nuevamente a hablar con el jefe de tienda el Sr. Guillermo Andres Arias el cual me atendió de manera amable, pero volvió a reiterar que por políticas de "Adidas" solo podemos realizar nota de crédito solo de podrá realizar cambio de producto...  

A todo esto tuvimos que incurrir en comprarle otras zapatillas a mi hija en otra tienda y de otra marca después de este incidente ya que tenía un cumpleaños y necesitaba unas zapatillas nuevas, Si necesitan les envió fotos de la boleta y producto para que vean el estado en el que se encuentra.

Atte.
Jonathan Carrasco.

My name is Ramy Makram.
I usually get Adidas Eau De Toilete and Sprays (Force, Dive, Pulse). Yesterday I got perfume and spray FORCE from Adidas Store in Roushdy Alexandria, Egypt. Today, I've test the perfume on my hand and it was too weak like if I put neutral water on my hand. I went to the branch and I met someone called Tamer Amin "Maybe he is the branch manager not sure"; he was respectable but he didn't want to listen to me at all and all he wants to prove that the perfume is normal. I even told him to test himself to check it but he refused. I didn't want my money back, but I wanted another usable one as the one I have is really like water.
I'm an Adidas customer and this is first time to face this problem.
I have the receipt mentioning that return/exchange could be in 14 days, but he refused to give me another one as well.
Kindly advice about this problem as this wasn't Adidas standard.
I'm very disappointed from the quality of the perfume I got!!

Waiting for a contact,

Ramy Makram
Alexandria - Egypt

ich habe mir überlegt auf meiner Instagram Seite ein festes Ritual zu entwickeln. 

Gesagt getan – es gibt nun jeden Monat eine persönlich von mir zusammengestellte und gestaltete Beauty und Lifestyle Box zu gewinnen. 

Ich habe sie liebevoll die „be yourself“ Box genannt.

Die erste Ausgabe hat im August ihren Gewinner bereits gefunden und natürlich möchte ich euch auch allen zeigen, was in der Box versteckt war. Im August lautete das Motto: My first Date. 

Auch etwas von euch hat es in die Box geschafft :-)

Ich freue mich über jedes Feedback. 

Die nächste Box wird ab dem 01. September auf meiner Instagram Seite (sophias.kleine.welt) verlost und trägt das Motto: Zeit für dich - Lehne dich zurück und entspanne.

Liebe Grüße, Eure Sophia <3

WORLD NUTELLA DAY: A POSITIVE CONCLUSION 

Positive direct contact between Ferrero and Sara Rosso, owner of the non-official Nutella fan page World Nutella Day, has brought an end to the case.
Ferrero would like to express to Sara Rosso its sincere gratitude for her passion for Nutella, gratitude which is extended to all fans of the World Nutella Day.
The case arose from a routine brand defense procedure that was activated as a result of some misuse of the Nutella brand on the fan page.
Ferrero is pleased to announce that today, after contacting Sara Rosso and finding together the appropriate solutions, it immediately stopped the previous action.
Ferrero considers itself fortunate to have such devoted and loyal fans of its Nutella spread, like Sara Rosso.

Hi Target,

I bought gummy kid's multivitamin from you but this is what I received :(
Pretty soon I will have two more slots on my cartwheel
Nice backgroud design !!!

Target, I am truly disappointed with the changes you made to your diaper. I have been using the up and up diapers since my 8 year old was a baby and now use them with my boys. I loved everything about them. Until now. My boys have started consistently peeing through them. At first I thought it was just time to move up a size but that hasn't helped. I am currently writing this at 3am because my youngest peed through and of course woke up. If it isnt broke, dont fix it. You should have just left them alone!!

I am a Mother of child with Down Syndrome.  I read this post and my stomach cringed thinking that this is what I will have to worry about from people, but more importantly, now businesses that I would spend my money in.  From what I have learned, the Down Syndrome community is a very close knit one.  So if you insult, or allow this type of disgusting abuse and harassment at your stores, you better believe it will be spread quickly.  Did I happen to mention that this is a post on the Down Syndrome awareness site??? 

Bathroom policies, I could care less about.  But basic human rights and treatment I DO!!! I suggest you RE-evaluate this location.  It not only opens my eyes to how I should better spend my money.  It also makes me embarrassed to think I used to work for Target.

I never complain about customer service, I am a customer service representative myself and  am more inclined to send emails etc.with compliments. However while shopping in the Westborough MA store this evening a supervisor (manager)?really irritated me.  I was purchasing a wire basket, the shelf said it was one price, it rang up another price. The cashier called the supervisor over. He seemed put out that he had to go look for the tag on the shelf, but did it. He came back and because I had let the next person in line go ahead of me did bring me to another register. His attitude toward me was rude, his exact words were " first of all, someone marked the shelf wrong, this is for a pewter storage basket,but I'll give give you that price ".  
The regular price was 24.99, I got it for 21.24....3.75  was not really worth the attitude. I worked retail for many years, I know that things get ticketed wrong, I know things get put on shelves where they don't belong. There were several of these large greyish baskets for 24.99 behind the sale sign for 21 .24  for large pewter storage baskets reg price 24.99. 
The words " first of all"--- probably not the best choice to start a sentence with in the customer service industry.

I ordered a men's creeper head mask online for my son to use at an event Saturday.  I received a Where's Waldo XL Women's "Wenda" Costume.  I chatted to complain, they said they would send a replacement; estimated shipping:  Nov. 7th.  So they assured me it would be 4-7 business days, which was unacceptable as I had ordered it, for my 7 year old son,  for an event this Saturday.  They said to expedite shipping to call, so I did.  The first level of customer service said they couldn't help me, but it took them about 20 minutes to come to that conclusion.  They 'escalated' me to another tier, so after another 20 minutes on hold, I got someone who had no idea what I was talking about and proceeded to take another 20 minutes to figure it out (most of which I was on hold).  She then told me they couldn't do overnight or two day shipping, but they'd be happy to send me a $5 e-gift card.  Oh, and I get to keep the Wenda costume, which they don't even carry anymore (leading me to wonder how I ever received it to begin with).  Unprofessional, unsatisfactory service from a company I've done business with for a long time.  I guess it'll be ok, since my customer support representative said, "Sometimes things happen."  Just thought I'd share with everyone I can.
