Dear Target,
I purchased a dining set on Target.com on 9/18.  The dining table arrived damaged - unbeknownst to us because the instructions say to leave the plastic wrap on while assembling. When we completed the assembly and removed the protective covering we discovered the extent of the damage, on all sides of the table.  This is a 72" table that weighs over 50 lbs.  When I called into your online support, I was told by the first representative, Ronaldo that the item was discontinued.  I found this strange since on your site the table has a cute little banner that says, "New at Target" when I went to see if it was still listed on the site, Ronaldo hung up on me.  I called back in and asked to speak with a supervisor.  Horace began to assist, and initially he seemed as though he was going to help me resolve this issue.  When covering our options, he told us we could bring the 72" table in to a Target store to get a refund and place a new order - that would most likely get cancelled because the item is discontinued.  When I explained that would not work, because I drive a small vehicle and this table would require some sort of freight to move, Horace offered to have it picked up.  He then explained that in order for us to arrange a pick up we would need to disassemble the table and "put it in a box".  My fiance and I explained that there would be no way for 1. us to find a box to fit a 72" dining table and 2. we are not packaging engineers and would not be able to accomplish this task.  Horace then said he would offer us a $20 Target gift card to buy a box... not only was this insulting but was in no way resolving our issue. Our time assembling, disassembling, hunting for a box and packing is worth more than $20, and to be quite frank I am absolutely sure that a box that could fit and ship a 50 lb 72" dining table would cost more than $20. To make this long, disappointing story short, according to Horace, we have no way to get a new table sent to us and we cannot get a refund unless Target gets the damaged goods back, so we are stuck paying for a damaged piece of furniture. This has been one of the most disappointing customer experiences I have had.  Normally, I am proud to say "I love Target!" but not today, you have successfully lost a long-time loyal customer. Please see the attached photos, I will add more in the comments on this post since it only allows 1.

Deeply disappointed with my experience today. In August I preordered all the new Lego Dimensions expansions due out at the end of this month as they were on sale for 40% off. I could have used Amazon, as my instincts told me to, but stuck with Target due to my REDCard's 5% off and my general love for your company.

Today I recieved an email, without warning, that my order had been cancelled due to card-related problems. What were the problems? Why, the fact that my card number changed after YOUR company voluntarily "upgraded" my card to a MasterCard. Yes, the free upgrade that I did not initiate managed to prevent my charge from going through. And unlike Amazon who will email you an alert when a problem occurs and allow you to FIX the problem without cancelling your order, your system instantly cancelled it. The only consolation offered? Telling me I could just "reorder" the items. Except the 40% off promotion under which I initially did so ended a month ago.

When I reached out to chat support I was offered "the maximum price match possible for an expired promotion" of 20% off. Hardly a reasonable solution for an error that wasn't mine. After much pushing the offer was upped to 30%. And while that's progress, it's still unacceptable on principle. I passed up 40% off from an alternate retailer who would have honored my original agreement with them even if *I* had been at fault for an error with my credit card to do business with you for a specific final total and, instead, I'm being shafted.

This procedure you have in place where any card error means instant cancellation, especially on a preorder, is completely unreasonable. Please fix that for your future customers. In the meantime, if this is the best resolution you can offer me, 5% off is no longer worth me rolling the dice with your company over Amazon who I know honors their purchase agreements. I will keep the order canceled, my kids and I will remain disappointed, and I will wait until these go on sale again at a competitor.

Earlier in September, Nina Smith visited GoodWeave-supported child-friendly communities in Rajasthan, India, together with our India team members and representatives from Target. Families in these rural villages often struggle with high levels of poverty, a lack of job opportunities, and poor quality public schools, all of which lead parents to put their children to work rather than send them to school. However, the child-friendly community program works to reverse this trend by engaging in an intensive community-driven advocacy effort that results in nearly universal and sustainable access to education while dramatically reducing the prevalence of child labor.

Parents, teachers & educators - if you know someone in the Twin Cities area that should attend UNCF’s college readiness tour tag them below!

Dear Target, I hate to tell you this in a letter but recent events have left me frustrated. Things just aren't the same between you and I, and much like Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt I think it might be time I divorce you. To be honest it's not you it's me, well and one of your employees. There's a particular lady at my local Target in mentor Ohio who is just always grumpy. She has a permanent scowl on her face , and I suspect her heart is black instead of the beautiful Target red. Most recently I encountered her because of some trouble I was having with the self-checkout, and she works in customer service. She came over to help, but with her elitist, grumpy attitude. After very arrogantly pointing coupon out fine print to a coupon that was different than the one I was trying to use she left me standing there with a substantial amount of items that she insisted I could not purchase as planned. Feeling very confused , I decided I would hold off on my purchase until I could better understand what she was talking about. but she had already stormed away leaving me with my special needs toddler who was half asleep slumped over the cart on my arm. I ended up having to go back into the store myself to put everything away , as I did not want to just leave it for the next person to deal with. Although this is not my only encounter with her, where I walked away less than pleased with her customer service skills this was the worst. And so I think time for a trial separation. I usually visit you no less than 4 times a week , the ladies at the Starbucks counter make my coffee perfectly every time and have always been amazing especially with my son. I'm sure at some point we will reconcile but for now I will be making my coffee at home and shopping on Amazon. At least that way if there's a price discrepancy once I get something in my cart it's just a few clicks for me to put stuff back.

I told him I didn't mind the delay and didn't want the percent off, I wanted the product considering my local target had them in stock and they couldn't guarantee that it would be delivered by the next expected date. I, with many other people, were in lockdown after the horrific stabbings that took place. Target and the staff did everything within their power to make the experience as comfortable as possible for the patrons and staff of the mall. They not only provided us with salads, chips, cookies, pop, and gum during this time but a manager even grabbed a bunch of phone chargers for us to use to remain in contact with our family and friends to let them know that we were OK. I truly appreciate the kindness that we were shown and will continue supporting Target and encourage others to do the same. They had no obligation to do these things for us, but they chose to. This organization cares about the community, and I can't thank them enough.

I am beyond disappointed with the customer service staff at Target. I pre-order every movie that comes out and had an issue with my most recent order. I received an email asking me to accept the new shipping date for the gift cards connected to the preordered movie. The link did not work however, so I called customer service and he assured me that he had confirmed the gift cards delivery dates. I then get an e-mail that the gift cards were cancelled. I call customer service and after being escalated, I am told that I need to manually cancel my order of 4 movies and then re-order all of them. I cancelled the order and re-order then get the exact same email for the new order today. I called and (after escalation again), I am told that there really isn't anything they can do. How is it possible that a customer service representative can not accept a new ship date or provide a $5 discount on the order since the GC is cancelled (despite the customer doing everything possible to get the new shipping date entered.) I am shocked and will be cancelling all of my pre-ordered movies (about 15). You've lost a customer and redcard holder over $20 (and the hour and a half over 3 diff calls to customer service). I'd be happy to provide my order number via email if you are hiding any IT geniuses that can fix my target.com order.

Do you work hard for your money?  When you give a gift card to someone, do you hope they get to enjoy it?  Do you value the security of your debit/credit cards?  If you answered yes, PLEASE READ!  This is not a chain/spam/copy and paste thing, it's totally me, Kristina typing this, although I don't mind at all if you DO share!!!  

I would STRONGLY ADVISE against shopping at Target for any reason.  THEY WILL NOT, I repeat NOT refund your money or replace your item if THEIR security is breached.  It's "not their policy".  

I purchased a $50 virtual gift card at Target.com for Keisha Hufford to be sent directly to her cell number.  I did so from my home, right here in Illinois. Convenient eh?  Sure!  It popped right up on her phone that very hour, and the money was debited from my account.  She then took the card to her local Target store, right here in good old Illinois, and attempted to purchase something with it.  She was told that it was "empty" because it had been redeemed in CALIFORNIA.  After over an hour of in-store hassle and phone calling to Target.com, she was promised a fresh new gift card to be mailed to her.  

No such luck!  Today she called to check the status and was told that her "case was denied".  They said again that the gift card was redeemed at a Target in California,  in order to purchase...wait for it...more gift cards.  That doesn't sound scammy at all, does it?  >:-(

Frustrated and EMBARRASSED at how my "gift" to her was turning out, I called them myself today.  Another hour wasted. Spoke with several "gift card specialists" who confirmed that it is not Target's policy to replace stolen virtual gift cards, even though they ADMITTED it was a security breach on their end!  

I called my bank this afternoon and they can not dispute the charges because it was an authorized transaction; AND AND AND...wait for it...according to my bank, THIS HAPPENS ALL THE TIME WITH TARGET.  

Moral of the story my friends:  TARGET is a corrupt and morally bankrupt company in literally every sense.  From twisted, liberal social policies to corruption at the financial level, they are just BAD.  You'll not find me there again; and I hope that this post makes it to enough people to make AT LEAST a $50 dent in their profit margin!!!!  If I can't have my money back, and Keisha can't have her gift card replaced, then TARGET shouldn't get the money either!!!!!

I wanted to share with something that I came across at my local Target store today. While walking thru the little boys section, I came across a t shirt that I thought my seven year old daughter would like. I sorted thru the shirts and determined that a M would be best. A little while later I found a t shirt in the little girls section that I thought she would also like. Since I usually buy her girls clothes, I knew that a large would be the right option. I compared the shirt sizes in the store to make sure they were roughly the same size, and they were. When I got home, however, I noticed that the boys medium was larger, considerably. By almost 2.5 inches! That's an almost 5 inches around!
How does it make sense that a boys medium would be larger than a girls large? We are talking about children's bodies, which at this point (my daughter is 7), are basically the same shape. I know that this isn't the first time sizing has been brought to your attention, and I wanted to make sure you realize this is still an issue. As a women I can tell you for a fact that at your stores I buy for myself large in women's clothing, but I have purchased men's small sized shirts for myself. This is confusing and insulting. Is a human woman's body expected to be smaller than a man's human body? Throughout one's life? At the rate my daughter is growing, I won't be able to shop for her in the little girls section much longer. How I will explain to an 8/9 year old that she can't fit into the clothes THAT ARE DESIGNED FOR HER AGE GROUP but not her actual body size? I shouldn't have divulge her height and weight for you to decide whether or not my argument is valid. An average 7 year old should be able to be dressed in clothing labeled for little girls.

How was my Target run today? Irritating. Just left Viera Target and was unimpressed with their customer service. I had an item show up on a baby registry I printed out as $8.99. It rang up as $10.19. I showed the price to the cashier who informed me "We don't price match," (Wrong: they do. Learn your policy, please). I asked her to adjust the price that THIS store advertised as a sale item. She informed me I needed to go to Guest Svcs for that. I was like, "Why should I have to walk to another location to be charged the price you advertised for this item?" I asked her if she could do a price override at this register, could she get a mgr to approve it? In 2 seconds, she entered the override, charging me the sale price. But not without a tone in her voice, conveying her displeasure that I asked her to do her job, instead of pushing me off on Guest Svcs. She kept answering my comments with "yes ma'm" but her tone was incongruent with her words. All she had to do was put herself in my shoes. Would she want to run all over the store to be charged the correct price for an item? Doubtful. So why the attitude? Came home and read the Target Policy, to learn they DO price match and that the policy requires "guests" (shoppers) to visit Guest Services to get any price adjustments. Bad customer service, Target! Change your policy. Doubtful if I will be doing business with Target in the future. Only went there because a sweet woman I love selected their baby registry. Target, are you listening?

I am so beyond upset right now... So, my son watches nick jr... And as you all may know nick jr. Has shows such as paw patrol, Peppa pig, shimmer and shine and many more shows. My son goes to day care where, there happens to be more girls than boys so granted there are "girl toys" around. One of the little girls just recently got a new peppa pig set of toys. My son wanted one too.. He has been talking about getting peppa pig toys for the last two days. Tonight my fiancé and I decided to go to target to buy his toy along with some other need household goods. We went to the target in Pasadena Ca on the corner of Colorado and Sunnyslope. While there we were looking though the toy section looking for some type of peppa pig toy and they had nothing. Not one peppa pig toy! So we told my son to pick something else. He chose a set of shimmer and shine dolls. We continued to shop (which during the whole time my son was so excited about his shimmer and shine dolls)and when we were done we went to check out! When we were checking out the cashier who's name was crystal felt the need to ask me if the dolls were for my son. When I said yes she made the ugliest facial expression and said "oh no, you can't buy him dolls he is a boy. Dolls are for girls. Why are u buying him those." I couldn't believe what she said. I told her that's what my son wanted so in buying him those dolls. At that point my son began to cry. He was so upset that she said those dolls weren't for him. She looked at me and said "oh no" and proceeded to ring me up for the rest of the items. I remained calmed finished checking out and my fiancé took my son to the car while I waited to speak to her supervisor. His name was Juan. I explained to him what happened and I expressed to him how unprofessional, inappropriate, and down right absurd it was for this employee to tell me that I can't buy my three year old son a set of dolls. The supervisor who was of no help at all offered me a gift card so that I may buy a drink from Starbucks and "cool off"

I jut can't believe this whole experience. It was my understanding that target was very  accepting and non-discriminatory. I just can't believe this. I am so upset. That target employee had no right telling me I cannot buy my son the toy he wants because "it's for girls"!! And how dare she make my son cry..  I don't even know what else to say... Just please like and share this post this is absolutely unacceptable and it needs to stop!!!

Carlos Santana’s former lead vocalist, Leon Patillo is doing all he can to create awareness of the anti-bullying movement. And his “RISE ABOVE THE BULLYING” massage is focused on this silent epidemic that is plaguing our youth. His music is centered toward the Anti-Bullying movement, and aims to empower the bullied and to give instructions to bullies. The effects of bullying are more widespread than ever before. Bullying is nothing new! His efforts are created in response to the steady increase in bullying across not only the United States but worldwide! Bullying in schools and online has led to so much tragedy in the lives of children. Leon's message is powerful, and is focused on the fact that bulling isn’t limited to just school grounds. Parents need to become more aware of the anti-bulling movement, and educate their children on this topic! His goal is to mentor kids to influence other kids for the better. Keep an eye open for Leon's next CD release and his 2017 national and international tour, its focus is on anti-bulling!

Our goal is to convince talk shows in having Leon Patillo as their guest for the month of October, and that Leon can help create a good show for their audience. It’s all about Anti-Bullying

Dear Target, I have a problem with you right now. I was just casually meandering through your clothing just now and I stumbled upon this shirt... And I went from 0 to furious in about six seconds. You see, I have been struggling with bulimia nervosa, an illness known for binging and purging, for the majority of the past six years. And boy have they been fun years: damage of an unknown degree to bones/ joints/ and my reproductive systems, as well as lesions in my esophagus ( which means that I've thrown up my fair share of blood) and contributing to this arrhythmia in my heart. Hello Target!  I am the principal at Cherry Park Elementary in the David Douglas School District in Portland, Oregon.  Recently our school has been in the news for changing our homework policy.  Our focus is instead of the typical homework we want families to engage with their children with board games, art and movement.  We are a high poverty school with 75% of our students living below the poverty line with over 30 different languages spoken.  Therefore, I am asking if Target would be open to donating games, art supplies or items to increase physical activity to our 600 students.  We are going to be filmed next week for a national network news program and thought it would be cool if Target could be highlighted donating games and other items to promote family engagement.  I'd be happy to give details and exchange information if you would like to talk further.  Thanks for your consideration.

To whomever reads this comment,

      I love your store in Port Charlotte Florida. Its an older Target. It's not a "Super Target", but it's our Target. My family and I (up until this weekend) have kind of a ritual that has been a part of our lives since before my daughter could walk, and we just celebrated her 6th birthday last week. It happens every Saturday or Sunday morning after walking past the big red balls into the front doors we shoot right to the Dollarspot while we wait for coffee from Starbucks. After getting the "$10 chocolate milks" as they have been affectionately nicknamed in our family, we make our way around the outside of the entire store. Through women's clothing, pass through children's shoes, a brief stop in the men's section to look at T-shirts, before landing in what has become the heart of our experience. My wife and I usually take our daughter through the toy isles and let her pick something out. Something small not more than like $10-$20, you know depending on her behavior the previous week at school and while shes in the store. Then back through electronics, through the seasonal items, then grocery for a few things health and beauty for a few things, through the pet are and finally back at the registers where we pay for our items with our red card, and the whole reason for this comment.

     Now I'm not one to typically put my business out there, but after talking to multiple customer support associates, and talking to an "on duty supervisor (Donna from Arizona) over the phone I have gotten no where with an issue that I along with countless online reviews believe needs to be addressed.

    Now I am a faithful user of my Target Red Card I love the 5% off perk and the option to pay it at the end of the month without incurring any fees is what I look for in a great Dept Store Credit Card. Now on the 1st Saturday or Sunday of the month. I have set up my auto pay on said Target Red Card to pay my minimum payment directly from my bank account IF DUE. This is for situations that may arise and I don't make it to the counter before my due date. Though this specific instance I did however make a payment at the counter before the due date. Not only did i make a payment but I had recently changed banks and wanted to make sure everything was correct with my auto payment. So I set a payment to draft and was not given any failure prompts. Also it was on this day that my "auto" payment was due, but the week prior to this I had made a desk payment which would mean there shouldn't have been a minimum balance due for this billing cycle. After realizing that my payment hadn't gone through because of an error of transposing two numbers in the new account info I quickly went in and paid the full balance to ensure there would be no issues with my card i would hate for some minor confusion to cause a wrinkle in what had been an otherwise perfect credit relationship over all these years.

     It wasn't until two weeks later when I received a letter saying my account had been closed for "NON PAYMENT" that I began this trip in what has now  turned from confusion to anger. I did what every responsible person would do I immediately called Target Red Card Services and it was explained again the account had been closed due to non payment. I explained that it was impossible to close an account due to non payment when I had made my payment at the desk. i was then informed that " it is Target Policy if there are two consecutive returned payments the account is closed and sent to collections, no exceptions." I again tried to explain there shouldn't have been a second payment made. The payment made at the desk was sufficient yet policy says they have to close my account? I then tried to convey both "returned payments" were made within hours of each other. I understand if you had two returned payments within a 3 month period but for them to be in the same day I would expect there to be some concessions made. It was then I was put on a brief ( 21 minute ) hold and was connected to a Supervisor. Ms Donna from Arizona, though very managerial in tone she didn't seem too concerned with the honest mistake, the confusion or the simple math of the matter. She only drove home target policy.  "it is Target Policy if there are two consecutive returned payments the account is closed and sent to collections, no exceptions." After I explained that it was a new bank account and there was some confusion in the numbers being transposed Ms Donna from Arizona's tone changed. Then there was an exception that could be made if I could get the bank to take responsibility for the confusion. I again tried to explain to Ms Donna from Arizona that it really shouldn't matter because the second payment on their end should have never been drafted due to the desk payment and if there were no previous exceptions to be made of the policy why now that there was a bank involved have things changed? 

    In a strange twist there was silence on the other end of the line. No response from the on duty supervisor. I responded to the silence by saying I could talk to my bank but I don't see why that should make a difference if the error of the second draft. Again, just silence. Then the familiar tone of an apple device call ending.

    That's the whole thing from start to finish. After talking to my wife we've decided that if a company that we've frequented for so long thinks so little of our patronage that they can not use their best judgement and see that the acts were not malicious or the account was not delinquent before not only closing an active upstanding account but to attempt to poorly effect my credit by turning in a false "Non Payment" to a credit bureau. This is a company we will no longer be spending our hard earned money and I will make sure to pass this info on to my family and friends so they can make an educated decision for themselves.

   
Thank you for your time 
Kris Sadler
North Port Florida

I don't normally write these, but I feel compelled to share my amazing find today at Target.  My 8 year old son has autism and, like many autistic children, finding just the right clothes that feel just right can be a challenge due to sensory issues.  My son is particularly sensitive about pants.  Denim is "too stiff" while the button and zipper requires too much dexterity.  In his perfect world, sweat pants would be acceptable attire in every setting (the kid might be on to something).  Thankfully, Target answered our prayers with these Cat & Jack pants.  If you have a boy who struggles with sensory issues and pants, look no further than Target.  I found these little gems at Target today for $16.99/pair.  They look like jeans but have a super-soft cotton lining on the inside that feels like sweatpants.  These are three of the five pairs I purchased, but there are many to choose from.  ❤️

Target as whole has been a trying company to deal with these past few months with no one from customer service, corporate or store level responding or doing anything to make things right after the misrepresentation, bad packaging and all around screw job we got with the Star Wars: Force Awakens collectors edition. But over the past couple months the Target has been an absolute nightmare to deal with and get treated like a customer who would be glad to spend his hard earned money there. Despite the efforts of Katy and Anna, I had my last straw today with a cashier whose callous attitude escalated me into a tirade at Customer Service where I got typical excuses and no resolution as is typical for this store ultimately reinforcing my decision to NEVER do business with this store again! Essentially told by the cashier that I did not receive my Cartwheel by Target discount because I had made a mistake despite showing her that I very clearly had not. And surprise! When complaining at CS they discovered I was right and only made excuses for the cashier. The MOD Nathan knew me as he was involved with another incident of stupidity with employees in the DVD department a few weeks back that again was customer service at its worst involving an advertised item that was also on the Cartwheel app no being readily available because (they were going through some changes in that department) and made an effort to provide me something that should have been on the shelf already but people were to 'overwhelmed'? to do their their jobs. They lost another sale from me inquiring about the availability of the new Britney CD since it wasn't in the flyer and after 2 hangups and being on hold for 15 minutes the employee had no idea. 2 minute call to Best Buy and I got an answer. Called again to check on the availability of another item and reached an operator who told me she could not help me because she 'didn't know how to transfer calls'. Seriously! This is the person you put on your switchboard? Add in regular items constantly being out of stock due to (we're a lower volume store so we just don't carry everything even though we do have a slot for that product that's actually sitting in the back room but no one has put it out) I've dealt with Katy numerous times and she has provided exceptional customer service and was the ONLY reason I still did business with this store but in truth I should NOT have to talk to a manager every time I have a question about a product. At this point, only in the case of it being something that I can only get at Target will I do business with this company and it will definitely NOT be the Taunton location. Someone really needs to wake up and take a hard look at what's going on the stores because we all have choices as to where to spend our hard earned money and be treated like valued, loyal customers. After the lack of concern by anyone but Katy and Anna at Target, my choices are clearly Best Buy and Walmart Raynham! They treat people like they matter and would NEVER let problems escalate! Also, I'm not just throwing around store names. Due to the fiasco with the DVD new release last month I have taken my TV new release business exclusively to Best Buy. That business has amounted to $700 in the past 5 weeks and there are still 4 more weeks of releases to come. THAT'S what Target Taunton has lost!

Hello!
We’re four students from the Science course of the Sint-Eduardusschool in Antwerp, Belgium.
We’re looking into the connection between choice in sports, gender and origin. In order to do this, we need as many evaluations as possible. 
You would be very helpful if you could pass the survey in the link on to your friends/colleagues/co-workers. You can do this by sharing the survey on your website or through social media. 
Please let us know by mail if you would be able to help us! Then we will mention your company in our thesis.
After this survey, we will delete all email-accounts and you will not be receiving junk mail or ads. 
Through the following link you have access to the English, Spanish and French version of the survey. 
English: http://www.enquetemaken.be/toonenquete.php?id=286908
French: http://www.enquetemaken.be/toonenquete.php?id=286916
Spanish: http://www.enquetemaken.be/toonenquete.php?id=287983
If you would like to have the questions in another language (for friends, family, colleagues) or if you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us! 

With kind regards,
The Science-students of Sint-Eduardus                                                               
Kobe, Femke, Koen and Michiel

ATTORNEY GENERAL SEEKS CLARIFICATION OF TARGET'S BATHROOM AND DRESSING ROOM POLICY!!

Last May, Texas Attorney General and chief law enforcement officer Ken Paxton sent a letter to Target's CEO requesting clarification of the retail chain's bathroom and dressing room policy.

In his letter, Mr. Paxton said, "It is possible that allowing men in women's restrooms could lead to criminal and otherwise unwanted activity." The attorney general also stated, "As chief lawyer and law enforcement officer for the State of Texas, I ask that you provide the full text of Target's safety policies regarding the protection of women and children from those who would use the cover of Target's restroom policy for nefarious purposes."

Since Mr. Paxton's letter, Target has done nothing to prevent men from entering the women's restrooms and fitting rooms. Target's policy has now resulted in at least two separate sexual violations on women in Texas stores. The latest was just last week, when a man used his cell phone to video a woman in a changing room in a Dallas Target store.

In response, Attorney General Ken Paxton again reached out to Target, saying, "After this latest incident, I hope Target finally recognizes the importance of protecting its customers, especially in environments where they can be at their most vulnerable. I am offering them the resources of my office to help assist them in improving their safety procedures."

I am so disappointed in Target for changing their UP & UP Wipes. My baby was born in April 2016. When she was born all of the other wipes on the market chewed up my daughter's poor little butt, especially Pampers! We had tried a whole bunch of different ones, and settled on Target Brand wipes in the Purple Color. We loved how clean and simple they were, they didn't chew up her little butt(in fact I'd go as far as to say it helped clear up her butt combined with Triple Paste), and they gripped the poo as we wiped. These wipes were so good we felt confident foregoing the ointment regiment completely. These wipes were a fabulous product! The key word being "WERE"! I don't know why Target had to go and mess with a perfect product. They made them more cloth like, and now they aren't as pliable, and they don't grip the poo when we wipe. We go through twice as many wipes in each poopy diaper, simply because they no longer get the job done efficiently. We were so disappointed in this product with the new face. We had been so confident in the product before, so we bought a case of them in August, even though they had changed. That's one mistake I'll never make again with any product! The first wipe we used out of the new packaging made us immediately regret our purchase! Because of this rude awakening, the next time any product that I usually buy in bulk changes, I'll buy a small package of the new face to test before entrusting in the product I've come to know and love. After we painstakingly got through the case of these wipes, we had to begin our search for the perfect wipe all over again. For any of you other moms out there in the same boat as me(and I know there are a ton of you out there), we settled on "honest wipes". They are great! They are exactly like the Target wipes before they decided to changed their fabulous product. I honestly wasn't paying attention to the price though, so I can't tell you what the comparative cost is, but the product comparison is an even match to the original Target Wipes. Please Target....bring back the original wipes! These new ones are awful! Why, oh why, did you mess with an already PERFECT product?!

She said she would only give us $14. We thought that was poor customer service, but went with it. What she said next is the shocker. THE TARGET STORE BLUES.
Does anyone out there ever shop online at Target? The nearest Target store is over 80 miles from my house so I rarely set foot in a store. This week I decided to try ordering two items online from Target for the first time. When I checked out I was awarded a $5 gift card as a promotional event. Sounded OK to me! I never asked for it; it was just offered. Next day I get an email saying that the delivery date of the card had to be postponed a couple of days (no problem...), but it went on to say "If we don't hear from you, your item(s) will be canceled." Thinking this a little odd, I went to the Target website to approve the new delivery date. No problem. Except that there was virtually NO WAY to approve the new date. Isn't that convenient (for them)! So I called. No problem. The service rep said he'd take care of it and approve it for me. Today I looked at my bank account and see that I have been charged $5 for a promotional gift card. I call again. The explanation given was that the two products I had ordered were discounted $5 so I would be charged $5 for the card I never requested in the first place. The guy said he would refund the $5 dollars and hoped that I understood how much they value me as a customer. SERIOUSLY??????
I'm waiting to see if the $5 is actually refunded, but in the meantime, I will NEVER darken the doors of either their physical or virtual store again.
Unbelievable!
You would think that with all the publicity they had a couple of years ago with hacking of their credit card system they would try to improve their methods of doing business. Apparently they are just moving on to new methods.
What a sucky store.

I'd like to share my terrible experience at the Guest Services counter from your Riverview, FL (Bloomingdale Ave) location. 

I brought a humidifier up to the counter to get a price match to Amazon. Had it all pulled up on my phone to show the employee (I've done this a handful of times before so I thought I knew the drill). Once I told her I wanted a price match she goes and grabs her tablet to look it up, no problem I thought she'll see the same one I'm looking at and take care of the price match and I'd be on my way. WRONG. Target in store price is $49.99, Amazon price is $30.39, the one the employee found on Amazon was $44.99. I showed her my phone to let her know that it is in fact cheaper on Amazon. She just kinda shrugged her shoulders and said she needed to go by her tablet price. I asked her how she searched for it and she gave me some line of oh I find it on the target website then hit the little Amazon button and this is what comes up....Ok, cool? I asked her to type in the name of the product and search it because at this point she's only showing one result, she shrugs again and claims she doesn't know how to do that! I'm frustrated at this point, holding a sick baby that has now thrown up on me and your counter. I ask to see a manager, the 'team lead' leans over (in the middle orf trying to help another customer) and says oh we don't price match to Amazon Prime (I was signed into my Prime account). Ok fine I didn't know the fine print to your price matching policy. I'm irritated by how both of your employees spoke down to me and were unwilling to help. This is what I'd expect from Walmart, not Target. I ended up leaving the rest of the items in my cart and left. 

Got out to my car and called your 800 number for customer experience, that woman was just as unhelpful. She called the store, spoke to the team lead and got back on to tell me you don't price match to Prime. Ok thanks lady we've already established that! I want those two employees spoken to by a manager and told that they are at the guest services counter to help and not belittle me! 

I signed out of Prime and guess what I found?? The SAME EXACT PRICE (see photo). Is there now any reason you won't price match to this?! I'm going to go back up there today and skip the dumb employees at the desk and speak to a manager...we'll see how it goes and how I'm treated today!

My sister and I went into target on bayou in Pensacola, FL today. She's on crutches so I pushed her around on the buggy with the two seat attachment for kids because there were no wheelchairs available. Anyway we proceeded to go to self checkout since we only had a few items. I went to the very last register near the door since I had such a large buggy. The cashier, Vanessa, was at the end cap straightening it out. She immediately left that area and decides to stand right behind me staring at us like we were criminals. Her reasoning for standing there is because "these self checkouts always mess up." I didn't have one issue with the self checkout. She wanted to read the 4 coupons for eggland's best that I had so I gave it to her n scanned the rest of my items. She comes into my personal space, steps on my slipper because she's so close, and decides to scan my coupons herself. In the meantime, a guest next to us was asking her questions and wondering about a gift card deal. She's so busy in my area that she pretty much just tells the other guest oh well, you must've bought the wrong items. I'm pretty livid at this point. She infuriates me even more when she looks at my sister and tells her that she's going to have to ring up her own items n that I wouldn't be able to do it. My sister is in a boot and on crutches. Wth. She decides to look at her 4 coupons also. All while the guest next to us is still having issues. 

I understand watching out for coupon fraud and so on but for her to stare and be all up in my personal space, I do not agree with that. If target as a company is so scared of losing money from coupon fraud, don't bother putting in a self checkout then. Go ahead and have two cashiers with a line backed up to the clothes dept so that you can monitor every single transaction that goes thru. I'm sure this complaint is going to go nowhere because target on bayou is notorious for being unfriendly to couponers. You definitely need to train your cashiers a little better than this. I worked at this same location 10 years ago and it was never like this. You are starting to be worse than Walmart

Thanks a lot, Target. 🙄

I went into the Bethel CT store today and was told that if the register doesn't scan the coupon I'm using on its own that it can no longer be keyed in by the cashier. 
I understand that every business has the right to refuse a manufacturer's' coupon for whatever reason.
The coupon that was refused was a TARGET coupon that had been mailed to my house. Your store refused to take the coupon you sent me in the mail that doesn't expire until December 2017.
Honestly, this seems like a scam to me. You send us coupons on items that go on sale rarely and are expensive (in this case razor blades) to get us into the store, knowing that a) we will buy other things and b) most people buy those things when they actually have a need for them, so they're likely to take back the coupon and purchase the item at full price, especially if there are no manufacturer's coupons to use elsewhere. So you are sending this coupon you know you'll never have to accept.
I told the cashier I would not purchase the razor blades and the dog food (rejected manufacturer's, will purchase at another store with said coupon), so your store lost about a $40 sale.
Until this policy is corrected I will only be purchasing generic products from your stores, and will purchase everything else at other stores that will allow the cashier to key in the coupon if it is valid and just isn't scanning. 
I wanted to send this in a private email, but could not find a way to do so on your website, which is why I'm listing my complaint here.

I had a terrible experience at your Guest Services counter today at the Riverview, FL (Bloomingdale Ave) location today that I'd like to share. 

I grabbed a humidifier for my son's nursery and went up to Guest Services and told the employee that I wanted to price match to Amazon. I had the same exact product pulled up on my phone and ready to go (as I have done this a handful of times in the past and thought I knew the drill). The employee turned around to grab her iPad and starts looking it up, ok no big deal I thought, she'll find the same thing I did...WRONG! Target price was $49.99; Amazon was $30.39 (that's a significant savings!) the employee found it on her iPad Amazon for $44.99. I showed her my phone and she said oh well I have to go by what's on my iPad. I asked her when this started because I've done a price match within the past 3 months and no one has ever checked their iPad, she said oh it's been this way for years (horse poop!). I asked her how she searched for it and she said well I find it on target.com then hit the little Amazon button and this is what pops up. There was only ONE result the $44.99 one. I asked her to search by the name of the humidifier, she shrugged her shoulders at me and told me she didn't know how to do it. I asked to speak with a manager because I'm frustrated at this point and holding a sick, crying baby that has now thrown up on me. She leans over to the next register to ask the Team Lead, she babbled off something about not matching to Amazon Prime. I was logged into my Prime account so I guess that it was a special Prime only price. Ok fine, I didn't know the fine print to your price matching policy. I left the rest of the items in my cart out of sheer frustration and lack of professionalism that I received at the Guest Services counter by both the employee and the 'Team Lead'! I felt as thought I was standing at the Walmart customer service desk the way they were both talking down to me. 

I went out to my car and called the 800 number for Guest Services to let them know about my experience, that woman was just as unhelpful. She called the store talked to the Lead and came back and told me the same damn thing.

I got home, logged or of my Prime account and searched for the product again...GUESS WHAT?! I found the same $30.39 price that wasn't connected to any type of Prime deal or special! I have a screenshot- but of course can't attach it to this post. 

I'll return to the store tomorrow and hopefully that same rude and unhelpful lady will be working again so I can win at your price matching game. This time I'll show her how to operate a search engine so she can in fact find the same pricing. 

So disgusted with this experience, after I get my humidifier I most likely won't be returning to Target!

I wanted to voice some frustration about a product I purchased at one of your stores a couple months ago. I bought these globe string lights in anticipation of moving into my new house that had a screened in porch. http://www.target.com/p/room-essentials-25ct-clear-globe-lights-purple-string/-/A-17186971?lnk=abtest_searchpdp_1
It took awhile to close on the house, move in and get settled so I just now got around to hanging them up. As I was stringing them, one of the tabs broke off the light connector and the whole thing came down, shattered glass everywhere, cutting my foot and narrowly missing my 3 year old, who was in the other room. I called customer service to get some resolution and the only suggestion he had was to contact the manufacturer. I'm not going to do that. How much time should I be spending trying to get a replacement for a part manufactured by Room Essentials, which is a Target brand? Last I checked, Target was a 73 billion dollar company and I spend hundreds of dollars there each month. I can't believe you can't offer to replace the product or at least refund the money I spent. The customer service rep said it was because the product was purchased more than 30 days ago and I would need to go to the store I bought it and speak with a manager about it. I moved several hours away from that store, so going there would be a major inconvenience. I'm just REALLY frustrated at the customer service of such a huge organization. It's not some mom and pop place that can't afford to do the right thing.

Oh Target, how I love you! I love almost every single thing you do but one thing just has me ruffled still - The Toy Section. My son is 5 and recently fell in love with these little Twozies collectibles when he saw a friend open them at her birthday party - but I had to buy him one in secret when he wasn't with me because he refuses to look twice in what seems obviously to him the Girl Toys Section. But yet here he is: a boy who loves that toy, so it must not be a girl toy! There are so many toys I know he would love or has told me he loves (many of the Lego Friends' collections) but would never see because the aisles are still so obviously biased based on gender. You are NAILING IT on the clothes, especially for girls (still waiting on the unicorn/rainbow/dragon/astronaut combo for my son haha), but this area still needs some serious work! We spend so much time at Target as a family, sometimes even just to kill some time we roam around and have fun, but I really hate bringing my kids to the toy area pretty much for this one reason. Thank you for all you do, the rest is Mom-Magic! <3

Frustrated with the lack of Customer Service at Target.com!  After placing an order online for several items to be picked up IN STORE and the remaining to be shipped to my home, I find out that an item was canceled and was unable to be picked up in store. Which typically wouldn’t be a problem because I wasn’t charged for the item; however I ordered four towels and now only had three. Anyone can see how this could be an issue.  The store clerk told me there was nothing they could do and I have to REORDER the item online.  So I called Target online Customer Service at 1-800-591-3869, and spent over THIRTY minutes talking to a representative who refused multiple times for me to speak to a manager/supervisor.  This was after she recommended for me to drive to the next nearest Target to purchase the item in person. Great, she wanted me to drive three hours roundtrip to the next nearest target for a freaken towel to complete the set.  Then she told me to just to go online and reorder the item.  So let me explain WHY this is an issue: I took advantage of a sale on home goods on 15 sept on a set of towels, each costing $13.99 with the 30% discount.  Now because of an error on Target’s part, because I had the option to purchase all four and have it shipped to my home but was given the option to pick them up all in store; I’m being told to reorder ONE towel at $19.99 + $4.00 shipping for a total after taxes at $25.19.  DO YOU NOW SEE MY FRUSTRATION?
All I asked if for the item to be shipped with the remaining items. Was told they could not change the order. I finally get to speak to a manager, he informs me that he will waive my shipping charge but cannot allow me to purchase the item at the sale price. ARE YOU KIDDING ME??? 
Nearly 35 minutes FOR NOTHING! I've ordered nearly $3000 on patio set, bedding, and towels from target in the last two weeks. THIS experience has defiantly made me want to return it all right back!

Looking to share a recent experience with you.  I've been a RedCard customer since February of 2015 and a customer of Target for far longer than that.  On September 3rd, I planned to switch bank accounts so on September 2nd I placed a payment to prevent any issues during the change.  On September 3rd I added my new account and edited my auto pay to use this new bank account.  On September 12th my Autopay triggered.  When I went into Target today, my card didn't work.  I tried logging into my account to find that I had been charged $25 two separate times for missed payments and that my online account was locked.

I immediately dialed to pay my balance in full.  I was informed that I would not be reimbursed for either returned payment, despite the fact that the 2nd payment was proactive on my end to avoid such a situation.  I was also informed that my account was permanently closed and that I could no longer use the RedCard.  As a customer of years with thousands of dollars of annual spend with no previous incidents, that is absolutely absurd.  In 2 weeks my account was locked and deleted and sent to debt collectors due to a mistake and a very typical life change.  I was not contacted by phone or email and didn't receive a letter until the night I dialed. Target, you've lost a customer for life unless you remedy the situation.  I'll get what I need from the grocery store and Amazon until then.

Target,
It's sad to see a company that has had a stellar reputation for customer service fall so far. I'm not sure what you're changing internally, but the past year or so has seen your customer service disintegrate to Wal-Mart levels. My experience over the last two days has only confirmed the decline.
I was shopping in-store yesterday when I noticed a particular stand mixer in the clearance section and was stunned with delight at the price, but confused as to why is was that price. I found an associate (Employee#1) to help confirm the price so I could pay for my treasure immediately. She confirmed the price, but didn't have another in stock. The supervisor (Emp#2) stopped by the "educate me" on how clearance works and suggested I go to a different Target to see if they still had one. I was disappointed that she thought the way she spoke to me was anything close to polite, or helpful. I asked her how she was going to resolve this situation and offered to take the same unit in a different color at the promised price and was again "educated" that Target "doesn't do that sort of thing". 
Employee#1 offered to call other stores for me to find the product and possibly transfer it to our store. I happily agreed. She called another store and waited.... for 40 minutes. Knowing that a customer is waiting, and another Target employee is waiting, it still took the second store 40 minutes to locate and secure the item for transport. 
At this point I had been in the store with this issue for over an hour and (Emp#1) was beside herself apologizing for the wait and for the inconvenience. She treated me like a person, not a transaction, and for that I'm grateful.
Today I was pleasantly surprised to hear that my product arrived, but it wasn't the right product, and I was informed that there was a miscommunication about the pricing and I wouldn't be receiving the product I wanted in any color at the promised price. The options given to me were to take the wrong product at a "clearance" price both Amazon and Costco beat on a daily basis, or pay full price for the product I wanted but included a $35 gift card.
In the end, you won. I had them price match Amazon, they gave a 15% discount to apologize for my inconvenience, and the $35 gift card. I feel cheated, disappointed, disheartened. This is the quality of customer service Target gives now? I'll be giving away the gift card and shopping at Amazon for their vastly superior customer service, and Wal-Mart for their better prices.

I am totally disappointed in Target stores.
I went to the Winchester Virginia Store today to purchase a T-fal Ceramic Cookware set that was on sale for 59.99, however when I went to the store it was on clearance for 69.98. So I took the set of cookware up to the Customer Service Desk and asked about the price, the employee stated that she could not override a Clearance price.  I showed her on my phone the set of cookware that I wanted to purchase and the price it was showing was 59.99 and says sale ends on Sunday, she again stated that it was Target's policy not to override a clearance item with an item found on Target.com.  I explained to her that the Target.com site states the item is available only in stores.  I asked to speak to a manager, and the manager told me that Target.com can list any price they chose and the store does not have to honor that price.  My question to him then was: why does Target.com show an item that can only be purchased at the store with one price but the store does not have to honor that price. His answer was because a different store can sell it at a different clearance price.  But the ad specifically says "Sale ends Sunday" that does not mean it is clearance.  I asked him for an 800# for their Customer Service so I could register a complaint and he gave me a number for Target.com, and they could not help me, in fact they somehow disconnected the call.  I am not sure I will ever step foot in a Target store again, especially the ones in Winchester Virginia.

I experienced terrible Target customer service today. I ordered a Melissa and Doug Victorian dollhouse and a bundle of six (individually packaged) dollhouse rooms (kitchen, bathroom, dining room, living room, etc.) for my daughter's only birthday present. It was a big-ticket toy item costing over $220; a very expensive present in our home. I ordered it early so I'd have time to assemble the dollhouse and set up the rooms. One of the individually packed rooms was labled dining room but it had living room furniture in it! What?!? As a result, I had two living rooms and no dining room. I called customer service and told them about the problem and the error the Target quality-control department had made, thinking this would be an easy problem to fix. The Target rep told me to take the bundle of six rooms back to Target and they would ship me out a new one. I explained how that was a problem because the correct bundle likely wouldn't arrive until after her birthday and I wasn't willing to give up all six rooms and give her an empty dollhouse. I tried idea after idea to find a solution (have them expedite the shipping, or send me a new bundle now and I return the bad one, or send me an individual dining room instead of the bundle, etc.). Nothing worked and the Target rep refused to help me find a solution to their quality problem. I was so extremely frustrated with the Target rep and her robotic answers and her unwillingness to help. So, from what the Target rep told me, it appears my only choice is to give my daughter the five rooms for her birthday and then pack them back up the next day and ship all six rooms back to Target so they can (hopefully) send me another bundle with a correctly-packaged dining room. What a terrible answer Target! I am so terribly dissappointed in Target's error and their refusal to fix it. This is a toy for a little girl; her only birthday present shouldn't have to be taken away because Target's quality-control department failed and Target's customer-service rep was incompetent to help a long-time customer. So very wrong Target; you will lose customers this way!

I want to say I am so disappointed with Target and the so called warranty plans you sell. So this morning I woke to my son's PS4 not working and our wireless router not working. I purchased warranty plans for both. I called to start a claim on the PS4 and ended up with a rude representative. He continued to argue with me that my warranty was not for a PS4 but an Xbox. I told him I have the original reciept and the only items on it was the PS4 and the extended warranty. He placed me on hold before I had even finished speaking with him. He came back on the line, asked me to verify the model number, asked for my address that I had to repeat to him a few times then stated he would email me some label to which them I would need to pack up the PS4 and then I should get it back in a few weeks. I still had a claim to put in for the router and he hung up. So I tried to place a claim for my router online since I really didn't want to speak with someone again for fear I would only be upset more to only then get a message that says I need to call the manufacture of my router since it should still be under the original warranty which I knew was not correct since it's been over 12 months. I decided to call Netgear anyway to only confirm that my warranty with then did expire. So now I had to call and speak with someone in the Target Asurion warranty department again. Really sweet girl so I am grateful for that however she stated the system was saying Netgears warranty was 36months in one part of the system and that it had expired in another. She tried to correct it and then it flagged my claim stating it now needed review before it could even be started and that it could take 3 days for someone to call me to review it. So I my son does not have his $400.00 PS4 and we do not have our $170.00 wireless router even though I have purchased the extended 2 year warranty for both. This experience was an eye opener for me. Best Buy will be getting my business on large purchases from now on. I use to ALWAYS by my electronics from Best Buy because their warranty plan is AWESOME and so customer friendly. Anytime one of my warranty items had issues at Best Buy I could take the product and my receipt to customer service where they would check out my product to confirm it was not working and simply provide us with new merchandise and allowed for us to purchase a new warranty for our replaced items. Then out the door and back to enjoying our items. I am sick and have been on the phones since 9:00am and it is now 1:30. I have non working products, no shipping label for one and have to wait 3 days to get a call about another. Poor customer service Target. You really need to rethink how you do your warranty replacement process. You have lost me as customer. I will be sharing this complaint with the BBB as well since something isn't right with all of the wrong information the warranty departments has and the hassle you have to go through for something we paid for as a peace of mind. This has been nothing more than a NIGHTMARE. I now have to go out purchase a wireless router so my husband can work since it will be who know when before my claim is taken care of.

I am very sad and disappointed.  I shop at Target often.  In fact, "Target" was one of my daughter's first words.  Probably embarrassing to admit that, but there you go.

Anyway, I use coupons regularly. On my weekly trip to Target yesterday, I purchased some clearance school supplies and tried to use coupons for my purchase.  The coupons were for the correct item, they had not expired, and they were not for more than the reduced price.

The cashier tried to scan them and they were all refused.  When I asked her why, I was told that they had a new system, and that if they didn't scan, they could not be accept.

I confirmed with her and with the front end manager that the coupons were, in fact, for the items purchased and they were, in fact, valid coupons, and yet they were still refused.

I was told that they got new coupon systems in place because of coupons not being compensated for by the manufacturers.  Other than the system not accepting them, when I asked why they were not accepted, I was only told, "I don't know."  I was also told, "I don't know," by the store manager.  He was very abrupt and didn't seem to care either way.  

No other explanation was given, and the answer given to me was not even given with any sort of apology.  Very matter of fact.

I purchased the items, anyway, as I still wanted them.  I asked if coupons on clearance items would be refused in the future and was again told, "I don't know."  If they do not know, I think it is their duty to find out.

I called the 1-800 number and was told the same thing: "I don't know."  The woman I spoke to was polite and understanding.  I still don't understand how no one knows.

Can you please let me know why it states on the website that coupons are accepted on reduced item, but they were not accepted in-store.  And if the items purchased are correct and the coupon is not expired (and is a coupon from the Sunday paper - not even a printed coupon), will the new system continue to reject coupons at its whim?

I'm not going to threaten not to shop Target, anymore, because I am addicted, but please try to explain this system to me because it makes no sense and it made me quite sad.

This is not only a review of a glider but the poor Customer Service I received from Target. I purchased a Shemag Deluxe glider from our daughter & son in laws Baby Registry. They received the glider by UPS and the glider was broken. Our daughter called Target and they said they would send her a replacement. The Customer Service Representative asked her to take the broken Glider to UPS. The Glider weighs 52 pounds; she told him she was unable to take it to UPS so Target said they would arrange a UPS pick up. I called Target as well and expressed my disappointment that the glidet was broken. The Representative apologized for the broken item and said he would send a $50 Gift Certificate for our trouble. The replacement Glider arrived and it too was broken. I called Target. When the Representative answered the phone, it sounded like someone was having a house party. I thought I had dialed the wrong number so I asked her if this was Target. Yes, It was Target. I asked to speak to a Supervisor. She transferred the call to a Supervisor. I explained the situation and the Supervisor said something to the effect of "what do you want me to do? I asked her to document that the 2nd Glider was broken and I would call back because at that point I was extremely frustrated with their whole Customer Service experience. I called Target back and spoke to a different Representative. This Representative seemed very concerned and helpful. She told me that she would have to arrange a UPS pick up of the 2nd Glider. She said they would not be able to send out another replacement Glider. I would have to place a new order and pay for another one. She said Target would start a refund for the first order and it would take 7-10 days to refund my credit card for the original order. She also said she would start the process for UPS to pick up the 2nd Glider. The Customer Servive Representative said she would call me back the next day and I could place a new order for the Glider if my daughter still wanted it. She also said she would give me a $50 discount on the new order due to the  problems we had experienced. I felt relieved and pleased at the end of the conversation. (It was too good to be true.) I waited for her call the next day but didn't hear from her. I called Target's Registry and explained what had transpired with the 2 Gliders to a different Representative. He put me on hold for about 5 minutes. A Supervisor came on the line and told me that he would have to arrange a UPS pick up for the 2nd broken Glider. Once Target received the Glider they would process a refund to my credit card; it would take 7-10 days. He said the process had not been initiated by the Target Representative that I had spoken to the night before; nothing had been done. After he told me how he was going to handle the process of the return I asked him about purchasing a new glider for my daughter and told him the previous Representative was going to give me $50 off the price of the glider. He put me on hold and when he came back on the phone he said he could not honor that because the previous Representative did not document what she had told me. I was livid, truly upset that Target was not going to honor what I had been told. I made another call to Target.com to file a complaint and was told the same thing...because the Representative didn't document the conversation, they would not change their decision, or honor what I had been told. Save yourself fthe headache!

Last May, Texas Attorney General and chief law enforcement officer Ken Paxton sent a letter to Target's CEO requesting clarification of the retail chain's bathroom and dressing room policy.

In his letter, Mr. Paxton said, "It is possible that allowing men in women's restrooms could lead to criminal and otherwise unwanted activity." The attorney general also stated, "As chief lawyer and law enforcement officer for the State of Texas, I ask that you provide the full text of Target's safety policies regarding the protection of women and children from those who would use the cover of Target's restroom policy for nefarious purposes."

Since Mr. Paxton's letter, Target has done nothing to prevent men from entering the women's restrooms and fitting rooms. Target's policy has now resulted in at least two separate sexual violations on women in Texas stores. The latest was just last week, when a man used his cell phone to video a woman in a changing room in a Dallas Target store.

In response, Attorney General Ken Paxton again reached out to Target, saying, "After this latest incident, I hope Target finally recognizes the importance of protecting its customers, especially in environments where they can be at their most vulnerable. I am offering them the resources of my office to help assist them in improving their safety procedures."

Attorney General Paxton is taking a courageous stand against Target's unsafe and dangerous policy of allowing men into women’s bathrooms and dressing rooms. And...he's not afraid to step on some corporate toes to make sure companies don't put women and children at risk from sexual predators.

Hi Target, I’ve enjoyed your store for years, but I greatly encourage you to change your current policy regarding bathrooms and changing facilities.  Though you claim your policy is the only way to be non-discriminatory, you discriminate against female shoppers by requiring they share bathrooms and changing rooms with men.  Since the announcement of your policy, Sean Smith, who identifies as a woman, was arrested for taking pictures of a woman changing clothes in a Target dressing room, and two other men were caught filming young girls in Target dressing rooms.  Non-discriminatory policies like that which you have adopted pave the way for voyeurism and assault, such as when child molester Christopher Hambrook sexually assaulted women in shelters by claiming to be transgender.  I cannot in good conscience patronize your stores until you reverse this policy, though I certainly miss doing business with you.

I loved Target.  I spent almost $8000 a year at Target, using my Red Card.  I always pay in full and on time.  Today I tried to write a check for my purchases (about $231.00).  I was told that I couldn't write a check over $99!  I "chatted" with them on line and was told I needed to establish a check history.  Tried to go to their corporate web site, but no way to talk to anyone there -- it refers you back to the same site I was at.  So . . . I will not be shopping at Target anymore and I will cancel my Red Card.  Very short-sighted of Target!! And don't try writing a check over $99; you will be humiliated.  You won't have that problem with Walmart -- your check is immediately processed.

Sandbar Perfection Awaits ASP Top 45 for Billabong Pro Mundaka


Surfersvillage Global Surf News, 2 October, 2009 : - - Mundaka -- With the first stop of the 2009 ASP Dream Tour’s European leg behind them, the world’s best surfers are heading south into Euskadi for the Billabong Pro Mundaka where some of the best sandbars in years provide the perfect setting for potentially some of the best waves ever.
Event No. 8 of 10 on the 2009 ASP World Tour, the Billabong Pro Mundaka plays a pivotal part in the surfers’ seasons, with ASP Top 45 members scrounging for requalification points and the hunt for the 2009 ASP World Title still very much alive.
Joel Parkinson (AUS), 28, current ASP World No. 1 and last year’s event runner-up, reiterated the fact that if the appropriate swell comes, the current sandbar at Mundaka is poised to deliver some of the best waves in years.
“The sand looks incredible and if we get some waves here it’s going to be a really special event,” Parkinson said. “I love coming to Mundaka. The town is really cruisey and I’m able to slip right into the pace of things. I’ve always felt comfortable here and I’m looking forward to a good event.”
Despite seeming to run away with the ASP World Title after blitzing the first half of the 2009 season, Parkinson has stumbled in the last two events, collecting back-to-back equal 17ths in California and France. Even with the slip in performance, the Australian still remains in the ASP World Tour ratings’ lead and will look to rebound at the famed lefthander.
“Everyone has a couple events where they don’t get the results they’re looking for,” Parkinson said. “I’m not thinking about the last two events. I’m only focused on the one in front of me. I love Mundaka when it’s on and I’m looking at putting in another good performance here this season.”
C.J. Hobgood (USA), 30, defending Billabong Pro Mundaka winner and current ASP World No. 3, defeated Parkinson in a gun-slinging Final last year and is excited about the possibility of getting the break good this season.
“The sand looks really good and I heard there may be a swell coming next week which would be really exciting,” Hobgood said. “For me, I am just looking forward to having a normal event. I had a little bit shocker in France – I had my boards stolen, came back in a pretty exciting heat and then lost sooner than I would have hoped. I’m having an okay year, but I really want to win an event. I want a breakout event. Hopefully the magic is still here for me in Mundaka.”
In addition to proving pivotal in the hunt for the 2009 ASP World Title, the Billabong Pro Mundaka is also an important event for those looking to requalify for next year’s ASP Dream Tour.
Tiago Pires (PRT), 29, current ASP World No. 23, is coming off of his best result of the year, a 3rd in France, where he halted a rampaging nine-time ASP World Champion Kelly Slater (USA), 37, in the Quarterfinals. Brimming with confidence and at ease in Europe, Pires will be a major threat at the upcoming Billabong Pro Mundaka.
“I was having a pretty hard year until the last event,” Pires said. “I think I moved up like 10 spots on the ratings and now I feel confident heading into the rest of the year. Everywhere in Europe feels like home and I love the wave at Mundaka. I am looking to continue my momentum through the next two events.”
The Billabong Pro Mundaka will host the world’s best surfers from October 5 through 17, 2009.  The event will be webcast LIVE via billabongpro.com/mundaka09. For more information, log onto aspworldtour.com

Just received my order from Walmart and am trying to send them pictures of the jars in the carton. Out of an order of 48 items six had broken lids, 8 had torn outer packaging and that is not all. The box  with the 48 jars with not one bit of packaging material. That's right, 48 jars were simply boxed up and shipped out. There was not one word of FRAGILE  or GLASS or any indication that the contents were breakable on the outside of the box. Here is the really weird thing: Of the six jars with broken lids there were only FOUR pieces of broken plastic were in the box! Maybe I am wrong but if there are six broken jars and four pieces that match up with the jars it seems to me that the box was shipped with six already broken jars. I am absolutely disgusted with your customer service. I made a return to the Walmart here in Greeley, CO. I paid using my Bluebird Amex prepaid card. Because I used it they said they could only return to my card. But did not explain that it could take 5 to 7 business days. Due to an emergency I had to wait on this refund to get essentials for my family.  Now had I been told it could take that long I would have asked for a gift card instead, so I could buy what I needed at the time. I looked all over your website, store policy, all over the Internet looking for a range as to when I would expect my refund. No where, I mean no where does it state how long it could take. So I decided to call your customer relations, which is a joke of a title. I spoke to Charles and he sounded so inexperienced that I was amazed that he was on the phone. Yes, I'm frustrated. Yes, I'm tired from my ER visit. And this rep was clearly trying to get me off the phone with no information. I received no help at all as to what to do. And when I asked for a supervisor he refused till the 4th time I asked. He kept trying to say it was a Savings Catcher issue. When I tried to explain it was actual funds of my own he still tried to tell me the same thing. Then told me to call a different number but gave me no explanation as to why I should call or even what they do. He just kept saying he didn't know and to try someone else or that I just have to wait. He kept telling me I had to call Bluebird. Bluebird can't do anything because they have no information on the refund. Then he says I had to call the number he gave me. When I asked if he could transfer me, that's when he proceeded to tell me their closed for the day! Then I finally got Will, a supervisor for customer relations, he did tell me that I had to call card processing services. The same people that Charles said to call but they are closed. Even though Will didn't have much more to say, he did have the experience and maintained his cool as a customer service rep should do. Either way I'm stuck because you guys don't know how to train your employees properly. No one can explain how long it will take or why. No one told me not to plan on having my money back. Any other company and I get my refund with in a day or 2. But not Walmart. This has been the worst experience I have had with you guys. I'm done with walmart. I will be taking my business to a store that actually explains what's going on and not try to give me the run around. Somewhere that values my money as a paying customer. Hopefully you guys don't have an emergency and end up in the same situation.

Clint Bowyer's participation in the first elimination race of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series, Citizen Soldier 400, is an awesome way for him to support our country's armed forces. This race is sponsored by Citizen Soldier Film which is an amazing documentary about the 2001 Oklahoma's National Guard experience fighting overseas in Afghanistan. This raw and honest film is shot from the perspectives of the soldiers and includes real-life footage of their tour of duty. If you haven't had a chance, I highly recommend picking up a copy of this film, now available on DVD and Digital HD Walmart

With such big NASCAR events coming up, it's great to see NASCAR supporting veterans. The first elimination race of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series will be sponsored by the new and highly acclaimed documentary Citizen Soldier Film. The race, Citizen Soldier 400, along with the movie are great tributes to our armed forces, especially the National Guard. The film gives an immersive look inside the experiences of our men and women overseas. Including this race in this Nascar Spring Series is a small way of saying thank you to our troops. You can get a copy of the film on DVD or digital HD Walmart

Service Animal Policy - There has been an increase in pet dogs allowed inside my local WalMart (Windsor, Sonoma County). Why do I think they are pets? The number of eligible service dogs is small compared to the number I see entering the store for our community. There is no visible reason to assume they are service animals and the greeters are not asking the two allowed questions (Is that a service animal and what task does it perform?). An incorrect answer to those questions should deny access, but alas it probably is not. Additional procedures and training for Greeters and Managers is needed.  And I would like to see signage posted for the public that let's them know California will fine them for misrepresenting their pet as a service animal.  Fear of lawsuits should not drive an "all or nothing" approach from WalMart management.

Citizen Soldier Film employs a very unique technique to create an immersive experience for audiences: first-person perspective footage from helmet-cams. The film follows the lives of the Oklahoma National Guard, intercutting front line battle footage with raw, emotional, personal accounts of our service members. We learn just how close these men and women become during their time overseas. The brotherhood they form, and the love and respect they share for each other, is remarkable. Take a step into their shoes and experience it for yourself. Available on DVD at Walmart.
